job_summary:
Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.
There are two things that we want to share with anyone considering joining us.
Firstly, we’ve got big ambitions for our colleagues and the future of the organisation. These include our vision that inclusion and accessibility drive every conversation we have and every decision we make. We want our workforce to fully represent the communities and customers we serve, because a diverse business is a better business. We value every colleague, their diversity and the contribution that they make. When we say you’re welcome at BT, we really mean it.
Secondly, the one thing the pandemic has taught us is that a lot of current and future colleagues, where and when possible, want to embrace hybrid working. Therefore, we are introducing smart working at BT. Smart working means having the flexibility to choose, as a team, how and where you work depending on your team’s deliverables and needs; when you are at your shared core location to connect with others and when not. It may not be for every role, and, as part of the recruitment process, you’ll have the chance to discuss smart working and how it might work for the job you are applying for.







About this role

The role holder will be responsible for the in-life delivery of a bespoke 24x7x365 commercial Security Operations Centre capability to a specific customer contract. The role holder will be responsible for the day to day management of the Commercial SOC to contractual SLA’s underpinned by specific KPI’s. She/he will be responsible for various aspects of the Commercial SOC operation including but not limited to: 

24 x 7 pro-active monitoring for security incidents, 1st line support and reporting within the defined customer SLA
Management, creation & maintenances of SIEM dashboard
Developing a communication plan for level 1 and 2 SIEM incident handling
Incident detection and Analysis, reporting, incident classification, provision of incident report to customer based in systems defined to support the process
24 x 7 change management process each according to a well-defined procedure based in the systems defined to support the process.
Analysis of security rules and policies before they’re implemented.
24 x 7 communication customers about Incident Security and Change management according procedures and time scheduled defined in SLAs
Developing escalations to Security Specialist regarding process defined


You'll have the following responsibilities


 As a member of the Cyber Security Monitoring and Response team you will respond to immediate security threats on BT and commercial networks across the globe.


 Responsible for working in a 24x7 Security Operation Center (CySOC) environment.


 The CySOC team’s goal is to detect, analyse, and respond to cybersecurity incidents using a combination of cutting-edge technology and a strong set of processes.


 The CySOC team’s goal is to manage the change security process for simple changes and complex changes based in change catalogue agreed with customer.


 Responsible for managing phases of change; Layout, set up and monitor after change.


 CySOC staff work across the organisation, typically with incident response teams to ensure security issues are addressed quickly upon discovery. Monitor, analyse and defend against malicious or unusual activity that could be indicative of a security incident or compromise.


 Support aspects of the delivery of discrete security services that provide the security infrastructure for customers.


 Support elements of the Investigation and resolution as required and where necessary report incidents involving potential or actual breaches of protective security compliance.


Support the operational relationships with specific customers, suppliers and stakeholders, including all Third Parties, joint ventures and OLOs, ensuring the cost-effective provision of a professional Security service


You'll have the following skills & experience


A basic understanding of the cybersecurity landscape, including emerging risks and security solutions.
Knowledge of the TCP/IP protocol suite, DHCP, DNS, LAN/WAN, and Operating System concepts.
Knowledge of the OSI model and security that is associated with each layer.
Basic network security knowledge to include remote access, DMZ architecture, network monitoring, intrusion detection, and web server security.
Basic knowledge of security logging tools (log management, SIEM, Advance Security Anomalies Systems
Threat intelligence - You gather, record and assess information from multiple sources on security threats and reported incidents. You evaluate trends in data to inform decision-making and minimise harm to our business and customers.
Knowledge of security methodologies and processes for: Incident security, Change Management and Secure Communication protocols.
IT and data network experience.
Knowledge of at least one security methodology such as MITRE ATT&CK Framework.
Knowledge of TCP/IP Protocols, network analysis, and network/security applications
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.
Motivated and ambitious to work on their own initiative without needing direction Strong attention to detail.
Relevant experience of stakeholder management and good interpersonal skills.
Relevant operational knowledge and experience of risk management.
Knowledge of Security management, network and information security, people security and running of one or more services within a Security Operations Centre
Relevant operational experience, ideally within a Security or Network Operations Centre
Relevant experience in analysis & interpretation of data into useable and actionable information/intelligence
Relevant experience of stakeholder management and good interpersonal skills
Relevant operational knowledge and experience of risk and incident management
Knowledge of Security management, information security and threat intelligence – experience in the following is desirable: SIEM technologies, network security, malware defence and remediation
Effective Communication, including verbal, report writing & presentations skills
Experience in problem solving
Business acumen and including financial awareness


Benefits







About BT
BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.
We're now a global company operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 90,000 people in 180 countries. And we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential.
So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT
How to Apply
It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application!

Job no: 507003
  
Work type: Full Time
  
Location: Melbourne - North
  

At Visy, our people make us stand out from the crowd. We’re always seeking solutions, opportunities and possibilities. We look for people who see what’s ahead & run towards it. These people are helping us to achieve our vision to become the global leader in sustainable packaging solutions. Together, we can create a better world.
 The Opportunity:
 Visy is a global leader in packaging and resource recovery and has been a pioneer in sustainability since our inception. Our innovation, manufacturing and logistic capabilities are organised around an integrated closed loop.
 Due to an internal promotion, we now have an outstanding full time permanent opportunity for a driven graduate passionate about Cyber Security.
 As part of our wider Digital, Technology & Automation team and based at our office in Coburg, you will be working closely with the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO). Joining our small and inclusive Cyber security team will give you excellent exposure enabling you to grow and learn from likeminded experienced individuals.
 The Role
 Reporting directly to the Chief Information Security Officer, your key responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

Assist in the identification of system risks that either are impacting or have the potential to be impacted by an adverse cyber event.
Assist in the provision of technical expertise and assist in resolve complex issues that face the cyber security team across the technology and manufacturing automation landscape.
Provide reporting metrics from a range of systems to ensure senior management are aware of the state of cyber security across the business
Investigate and identify root cause, attack vector, exploitation and other techniques used to bypass
Ongoing research and analysis of the cyber threat landscape to stay ahead of adversaries and cyber-attack

What you will bring to the team:

Tertiary qualified with some exposure working within an IT function
Passion for cyber security and the drive to grow and learn in that space
Exposure to technology or information security systems and an interest in gaining technical and business skills
You are a great communicator, enabling you to form strong relationships with stakeholders on all levels
You enjoy being accountable and possess a real “Can do “attitude



 When you join Visy, you’re joining a global leader dedicated to making serious progress in the sustainable packaging and recycling industries. We want to find solutions, make an impact & grow our business. If you can help us, you’ll fit right in. There’s never been a better time to join Visy!
 You will be required to meet Visy’s employment criteria which will include a criminal history check and pre-employment medical (including drug & alcohol testing).
 Visy is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that  embraces & values diversity & inclusion.
 Advertised: 24 Aug 2022 AUS Eastern Standard Time Applications close: 28 Sep 2022 AUS Eastern Standard Time

Elevate yourself as a Cyber Security and build the career that’s right for you.  Are you new to Cyber Security or looking for more from your tech career? Joining our Tech Select Program puts you in the driver’s seat of your career, giving you the chance to experience new areas of technology, while building on your Cyber Security and professional skills.  Cyber Security at Macquarie  You’ll join a globally distributed team of cyber defense analysts, incident responders, threat researchers, security architects and engineers tasked with the mission of protecting Macquarie’s businesses from systemic cyber threat.
 We work with Macquarie’s security control operators and infrastructure and workplace technology teams to build platforms and integrate technologies which support the identification, containment, and eradication of threats in our environment.
 We work with internal and external partners to leverage telemetry and data analytics as well as automation and orchestration to solve the scale challenges faced by the cyber threat team.  How Tech Select works  Tech Select is purpose built for technologists in the early stages of their career. You’ll join a cohort of professionals who are passionate about accelerating the digital enterprise.
 You’ll embark on a 12-month development and mentoring program across your choice of technology disciplines. Whatever you’re looking for, Tech Select is customised for you, by you.
 You’ll have the choice of the following tech fields to rotate through:

Software Engineering
Cloud and Platform Engineering
Cyber Security
Data and Business Analytics
UX/UI – Experience Design
Customer/Tech Support

At the conclusion of Tech Select, your journey with Macquarie is only just beginning. As a permanent employee, you’ll continue shaping a technology career that’s unique to you.
 So, who are you?  You’re a skilled Cyber Security Specialist, or looking to become one, in the early stages of your career, ideally with some professional experience and a relevant technology qualification.
 We are an ever-growing global team who is accelerating the digital enterprise and delivering technology solutions that empower people to innovate and invest for a better future. If you want to join us and be part of our journey, while elevating your career, then this is the opportunity for you!
 To learn more about Tech Select visit https://www.macquarie.com/au/en/careers/early-technology-careers/tech-select-program.html
 About the Corporate Operations Group
 The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.
 Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
 The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
 We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.









About Macquarie

A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 18,000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.







Job no: COG-966741
      
Work type: Permanent - Full time
      
Location: Sydney
      
Category: Technology
      
Group: Corporate Operations Group
      
Division: Technology
      
Recruiter: Jessica Jabbour
      
Opening Date: 02/8/2022

$71,207 - $83,700 (plus Super + BDCP)
Harman - ACT, Macleod - VIC

The Role We are seeking a highly motivated APS 4-5 to join the Cyber Security Systems Infrastructure (CSS-I) team. Under broad direction, the successful applicant will be responsible to the Team Leader - CSS-I for providing ongoing technical support of the Defence Security Operations Centre (DSOC) cyber security systems.   You will have proven experience in the administration of Linux and/or Windows based systems, as well as familiarity with virtualisation and storage technologies.  The duties for this role will include: 

Building and deploy changes to infrastructure.
Contributing to automation for environment provisioning and application deployments.
Contributing to monitoring to provide visibility into system and application state.
Contributing to routine system maintenance, including patching, upgrades and deployments.
Participating in troubleshooting application performance issues as required, assisting development teams by identifying root causes or bottlenecks.
Investigating/prototyping new technologies and identify opportunities for improvement.

 The additional payment is a Building Defence Capability Payment (BDCP) which enables Defence to provide a premium, in addition to the rate of salary otherwise payable under the Enterprise Agreement (EA) to some or all of the jobs within a critical occupation(s) or discipline within a workplace. 
 
 Applicants engaged into a BDCP position must consider the following. BDCPs provide remuneration in addition to the Defence Enterprise Agreement (EA). This arrangement is subject to meeting eligibility criteria and is subject to annual review. Should your performance fall beyond requirements or the eligibility criteria not be met, your eligibility for the BDCP may be reviewed and ceased. It may also be ceased should you change positions or the requirement for the BDCP is no longer necessary, as determined by Defence. Should the BDCP be ceased you will be advised and your BDCP additional payment will cease.
 

About our Team
 The Defence Security Operations Centre (DSOC) is responsible for protecting Defence’s sensitive information and systems from some of the most sophisticated cyber threats across the globe. 
 
 The role we play here is high impact – we protect Australia and its national interests every single day. Our environment is operational and high tempo. We are passionate about our mission and like to be an integral part of building an advanced capability.
 
 DSOC’s Cyber Security Systems Infrastructure (CSS-I) team are pivotal in enabling DSOC functionality through the design, maintenance and support of the section’s cyber security systems. These systems need to be highly secure, resilient and adaptable to enable the DSOC to detect and defeat the cyber threats to Defence’s information and systems.
 

Our Ideal Candidate
 Our ideal candidate will:
 

Have experience working in a technical role supporting Linux and/or Windows Operating Systems;
Have good communication and time management skills;
Be able to provide technical contribution towards multiple projects in a complex environment;
Work cooperatively with peers in order to achieve results;
Have personal resilience and ability to solve problems; and
Be willing to learn and adapt to new technologies as business requirements change.

At ThreatDefence, we know that seeing is believing. Lots of products claim to do wonderful things but disappoint when the rubber hits the road. For us, the opposite is true. When people see ThreatDefence live on their security data, the potential suddenly comes alive, and the value appears.
 Start with us today in a carefully controlled and managed engagement, while we connect ThreatDefence to your systems, collect security data, and then work with your team to produce meaningful insights on your cyber security posture. If you like what you see, you can continue using the service on a monthly basis – and your first month will be free!











Required Skills





Good understanding of security basics 
Hands-on Linux experience 
Programming and scripting 
Working IT experience 
Customer communication 



















A Day in the Life

Being part of a 24×7 security operations team, security monitoring and threat detection
Serving as the first line of response to reported security anomalies and incidents
Investigating and escalating security incidents
Documenting security breaches and assess the damage they cause
SIEM configuration – dashboards, detection use cases
Managing customer service requests to ensure contracted service levels are met
Security system configuration and customisation.












Responsibilities





24x7 Security Operations 
Incident Response 
SIEM management 
Security analysis 
Reporting 



















A Perfect Match

A great passion for cyber security technology – we expect you to have some knowledge of penetration testing, malware/ransomware, OS and network security, security data analysis, etc.
Hands-on technologist – good working knowledge of Linux operating systems is essential
Programming and scripting skills (Bash, Python, etc.)
Good understanding of security principles, such as access control, security protocols, vulnerability management, incident and event management, etc.
Experience with packet capture tools and analysis of captures
Technical ability to resolve complex incidents and problems with focus on security products
Ability to work from home and be a part of after-hours on-call roster.
1-2 years of relevant IT experience.
Tertiary degree in computer science or cyber security.







Above and Beyond

Excellent written and oral communication skills
Proven analytical and problem solving skills
Customer service oriented self-starter with an outgoing personality.

About the Team: 
The Critical Infrastructure and Operational Technology Environments (CIOTE) section in the Cyber Uplift Branch, ACSC is responsible for enhancing cyber security resilience for critical infrastructure, with a focus on operational technology, and government around Australia. The ACSC achieves this through initiatives like the Critical Infrastructure Uplift Program (CI-UP) a key initiative of CIOTE. CI-UP provides organisations with a holistic evaluation of their current cyber security maturity, along with tailored advice and assistance to identify and remediate security vulnerabilities.
About the Role: 
As a cyber security specialist, you will be provided with a unique opportunity to undertake challenging and rewarding work that contributes to maintaining Australia’s national security. As a cyber security specialist - defensive technologist, you will help contribute to building Australia’s cyber security resilience by protecting critical assets and information.
To achieve our mission, we want people with strong integrity, agility, curiosity, imagination, resilience and creativity. These abilities are needed to out-think and out-imagine some of the most testing adversaries and problems imaginable. Cyber security specialists work in high-paced operational environments that require creative problem solving by self-starters and the ability to collaborate with others. We are looking for applicants who can think critically and have the aptitude to come up with innovative solutions. We encourage applications from anyone who is motivated to develop their skills and can adapt to the rapid pace of technology advancement.
Desirable Qualifications, Experience or Training
Our cyber security specialists have a mix of specialist skills and abilities. Candidates with experience or qualifications in any of the skills, disciplines or platforms listed below are encouraged to apply.

Cloud security design and implementation


Cyber and information security


Network design and implementation


Penetration testing


Programming/scripting/software development


Cyber Security assessments and auditing


Cyber Security program management


Systems administration


Systems and software design


Threat intelligence and modelling


Web-based platforms


Cyber security architecture

Eligibility: 
Please ensure that you meet the eligibility requirements outlined in the Information Pack prior to submitting an application.
Citizenship - To be eligible for employment with ASD, applicants must be an Australian citizen.
Health Assessment - The preferred applicant may be required to undergo a medical examination conducted by the Agency’s preferred medical provider.
Organisational Assessment – To be eligible for employment within ASD, the preferred applicant will be required to undergo an Organisational Assessment (see Organisational Assessment section in the Information Pack).
Security Clearance - The preferred applicant will be required to successfully undergo the security clearance vetting process at a specified clearance level. The preferred applicant
MUST be willing to disclose all relevant and required information.
Application Closing Date: Sunday, 14 August 2022
For further information please review the job information pack, reference ASD/04126/22 on https://www.asd.gov.au/careers
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $69,811.00 – $119,651.00 per year
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

How will I help? 
We are looking for graduates who are curious, enjoy problem solving, and are innovative thinkers to join the Critical Protective Controls team. If you are in the STEM field or not, or just realised that cybersecurity keeps catching your attention, we may just have the right environment for you to experience firsthand what it’s like to become a cyber sleuth. 
The team is made up of professionals who manage cybersecurity controls used to prevent, detect and mitigate threats and attacks. Our countermeasures and safeguards are applied globally 24x7, 365 days a year. We protect Westpac Group digital assets from attackers who maliciously aim to do damage, steal data, exploit unauthorised access for financial gain. 

What’s in it for me? 
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure. 

What do I need? 
The ideal candidate will want to make a difference, protecting the community against cybercrime. They will enjoy challenges that will push and reward you at the same time and want to develop a cyber career with excellent growth opportunities. 

What’s it like to work there? 
As well as competitive remuneration and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. 
We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. 
As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion. 

How do I Apply?
 
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply. 
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces. 
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy , and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

location: Temporarily Remote in Sunshine Coast QLD
job_summary:
Category: Information Communication & Technology 
         







          Work Type: Temporary/Max Term Full-time 
         







$99K – $106K Total Remuneration Package (pro-rata) $88K – $94K Base Salary (pro-rata) Location: Sunshine Coast and WFH Temporary - Full-time Applications close: Monday, 12 September 2022 11:59pm AEST


 Why work with us?
There is no better place to live and work than on the Sunshine Coast, especially with an outstanding organisation like Sunshine Coast Council.


With the vision to be Australia’s most sustainable region - Healthy, Smart, and Creative, council is at the forefront of delivering a number of region-shaping projects that will see the region become a hub for innovation, entrepreneurship and creativity, along with opportunities and a lifestyle for all to enjoy.


About the Role
Are you a technical cybersecurity expert looking for a unique opportunity to take a lead role in Councils dedicated Cybersecurity Program?


In an era of ever-advancing technologies, it is essential to have outstanding cybersecurity systems, policies and processes in place. Council are seeking to appoint a Security Analyst to provide technical expertise to the design, planning, integration and implementation of security initiatives as well as intelligent auditing, monitoring and logging toolsets.


Risk reduction is a large component of the role, including provision of advice and solutions to internal stakeholders that ensure Council’s information assets are protected from accidental or malicious damage.


As part of your role, you will educate and mentor staff on contemporary cybersecurity risks and empower them on further steps to carry out in reducing security violation risks, as well as interact with external service providers and vendors where needed.

 Please note flexibility to work remotely will be considered for this vacancy.


About you
Tertiary qualifications in IT, coupled with professional certifications or significant Cybersecurity experience will set you up for success in this exciting role. Pivotal to this position will be your strong expertise in applying industry legislation, policies, procedures, standards relating to IT infrastructure design, Qld Government Essential 8 and the international framework ISO27001.


A highly developed communicator, your interpersonal skills are effective, particularly in consultation and conflict resolution. Complementing this are your analytical abilities to research, evaluate and provide resolutions to complex problems within a diverse client base. You are well versed in working with third party service providers, vendors and consultants to achieve a common goal.


Knowledge of and experience working with, security infrastructure such as firewalls and network switches would be advantageous. Candidates with experience understanding network security concepts as well as those with knowledge of principles of securing cloud-based applications will be well regarded.


Our Culture & Employee Benefits
Council is committed to creating an inclusive, culturally diverse, healthy, skilled and dedicated workplace culture. As an employee you will enjoy a range of benefits which include but are not limited to: 

9-day fortnight - to support your enjoyment of the lifestyle benefits Sunshine Coast has to offer.
Flexibility to work remotely can be considered
Salary Packaging 
Pay you 17.5% loading when taking annual leave (4 weeks entitlement per year)


 
How to apply
Submit a resume / CV and cover letter detailing your suitability for the role, including your ability to fulfil key responsibilities and requirements on the Position Profile.


Further Information
Helpful information to assist you in completing your application is available on the Sunshine Coast Council website.
 
For specific enquiries contact Tracy Frye, Project Manager Cybersecurity Program during business hours on 0427 476 635


To our valued community; as the novel coronavirus COVID-19 continues to impact our community and daily lives, we want to assure you that we are monitoring developments very closely and taking all appropriate action. Keeping this in mind, please be aware that our recruitment process may take longer than average, and we ask that you remain patient during these prolonged periods.


Through its Reconciliation Action Plan, Sunshine Coast Council supports social and economic opportunities for Traditional Owners, the Kabi Kabi and Jinibara people and the broader First Nations community and as such strongly encourages local, First Nations people to apply.

An excellent opportunity has become available for a highly motivated and passionate Security Testing Specialist to join the Information and Cyber Security team.

 The opportunity:
 As the Security Testing Specialist, you will be responsible for proactively conducting assessments of threats and vulnerabilities, scanning, and assessing the level of exposure and recommending appropriate countermeasures to protect and defend Telstra from cyber-attacks and successful exploitation of identified vulnerabilities.

 Please note all candidates must be Australian Citizens and will require you to obtain and hold a Negative Vetting 1 (NV1) security clearance.

 Your key responsibilities and major tasks include, but are not limited to: 

 Conducting assessments of threats and vulnerabilities to proactively identify and define vulnerabilities and threats impacting the Telstra enterprise network.
 Examining our environment and considering techniques to improve identification of vulnerabilities and detection of threats.
 Executing vulnerability scans, documenting, and interpreting results to identify security lapses in the system
 Liaising with stakeholders to notify, share and obtain information around vulnerabilities.
 Preparing metrics on vulnerabilities, identifying patterns and trends in vulnerability data and correlating with vulnerability intelligence.
 Conduct authorised exploit validation of systems and utilise a suite of network monitoring and vulnerability scanning tools to expose threats, vulnerabilities, and potential attack vectors in a system
 Collaborating with other security and technology teams in proactively mitigating vulnerabilities.
 Providing security technical expertise support on operational and non-operational matters that contribute to the defence of Telstra corporate platforms and technologies.
 Using commercial and open-source reconnaissance tools to discover assets and onboard assets into scanning tools.
 Develop security testing reports, highlighting key threats and areas for improving system security


 Enough about us, let's talk about you. To hit the ground running we are looking for individuals who can confidently demonstrate the following:

 Be an Australian Citizen and have the ability to obtain and hold an NV1 AGSVA security clearance.
 Proven experience working in an Information Technology role
 Experience in a cyber security specialist role
 Understanding of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.
 Understanding of vulnerability classes and vectors.
 Understanding of common vulnerability scoring system (CVSS).
 Tertiary qualifications in Electrical/Electronic, Computer, Network or Software Engineering; Information/Cyber Security; IT or a related discipline
 Understanding of networking protocols and how they relate to security
 Experience in scripting and coding for security data analysis (e.g., Python and PowerShell) – Highly Desirable


 Our perks & benefits:

 Work-life integration - we understand life happens when you're busy making other plans, so we offer flexibility around where, and when you work.
 16 weeks paid parental leave for primary and secondary carers.
 Professional development program.
 An epic (free) Telstra mobile phone plan.
 Laptop/Device allowance renewed every 2 years.
 Purchased Annual Leave scheme.
 Discounted Telstra products and services.


 We fully embrace flexibility and choice at Telstra and it’s as unique as you. We believe every role can flex in some way and encourage you to work where, when, and how you are most engaged, safe, and productive. Talk to us about how a role could be flexible for you!

 To attend a Telstra premises in certain states / territories, employees will be required to be vaccinated against Covid-19. This is ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people and customers. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances.

 On the cusp of the next technological transformation in the digital world, Telstra has and continues to be at the forefront of local and global innovation. Come disrupt and lead the industry as we build the networks for the future and push the boundaries of what’s possible with technology.

 We're after the right blend of experience and enthusiasm and look for cultural add, rather than cultural fit. We benefit from the unique gifts and backgrounds of each person in our business and push for diversity of thought in all we do.

Role: Cyber Security Analyst Location: Sydney + Hybrid Division: Multiple Opportunities
About The Role
 For this exciting role, you have a passion for information security and are keen to learn new skills. This role is suited to candidates with a broad knowledge of information technology, wishing to develop their career in cyber security. You will develop your technical skills and become a key member of a specialist team.
 Your Responsibilities

Develop software, integrate solutions and automate processes for internal and customer facing systems
Identify security threats to clients' operations
Use APIs to integrate third party software applications
Develop processes, products, services and methodologies to introduce new service offerings or improve the delivery of existing services
Assist in incident response and forensic investigations
Participate in solution architecture and functional requirements development
Constructively collaborate with other team members

Requirements

An undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or relevant experience in a software development role
Strong ability to troubleshoot problems in methodical and efficient manner
Good communication skills (verbal and written)
Experience with object oriented programming languages (eg. Java, C#)
Experience with scripting languages (eg. Python, PHP, JavaScript)
Ability to clarify ambiguity and synthesise complex issues succinctly
Credit or above results for undergraduate degree

Desired

Experience with Relational Database Management Systems (RDMS) e.g MS-SQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL
Knowledge of web application and server technologies
Familiarity with Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP)
Exposure to CTFs
Hands-on discovery demonstrated through home lab and/or GitHub repo

What's on Offer

Excellent Salary + Benefits + Performance Bonus
Tools of the trade, latest tech, etc.
Opportunity to have your contribution recognised and valued as part of a team
Flexible working environment, great workplace culture
Be mentored by a team of experienced cyber security specialists
Training and professional development is an important part of life at Security Centric and you will be supported in acquiring and maintaining relevant industry certifications such as CISSP, GSSP, GWEB, OSCP, etc.

job_title: Experienced Cyber Professionals (Multiple roles for Perth)
job_summary:
Date: 17-Aug-2022 


Location:
 Perth, WA, AU 


Department: Risk Advisory 


Description:

Job Requisition ID: 27369 



Flexible work arrangements across Perth – work in a way that suits your life
Pathway to Partnership – receive support and mentoring to progress your career
Working Visa sponsorship
Relocation packages will be considered
 Would you like to call Perth home? 

 We are calling on Cyber Professionals across a range of levels wanting to move to Perth (Western Australia). 

 You will bring a strong balance of technical experience, communication, and interpersonal skills, which will enable you to engage at all levels of an organisation around the cyber risk agenda. A wide range of security advisory services, such as cyber security strategy, threat and risk assessments, security design, and transformation. You will work within a diverse team who are passionate about helping organisations to assess, define and sustainably implement cyber security capability. 

 We are currently hiring for various roles from Consultant through to Director level across Cyber Security, Strategy and Analytics. We are open to considering candidates from a variety of Cyber backgrounds and we have internal programs and pathways to guide your career path. 

 Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. 

 Enough about us, let us talk about you. 


You are someone with:


Proven experience in a cyber security or advisory role
Experience in performing security threat and risk assessments and delivering projects relating to security strategy, governance, security architecture and capability improvement
Background in strategy/framework/assessment/TPRM would be beneficial
Cloud/Network/IT Security (AWS, Azure)
GRC (governance, risk, compliance), CPS (Cyber Physical Systems)
CISSP, CISM, CCSP, CISA, OSCP, CEH, Security+ certifications
Cyber Security Architecture (multiple domains) experience
Proven experience in a cyber security or advisory role
A strong desire to develop your leadership skills and impact, working across a range of digital and cyber transformation programs
Experience in performing security threat and risk assessments and delivering projects relating to security strategy, governance, security architecture and capability improvement
Experience working with leading industry security frameworks – detailed knowledge of NIST, PSPF and ISM will be strongly regarded.
Technical experience in relation to cloud security, end point security, identity and access management or data protection will be strongly regarded
 We would love to have you in Perth! 

 Why Deloitte? 

 At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles.

job_title: Information Technology Trainee Certificate IV Cyber Security
job_summary:
Sydney NSW, Australia
 









Exciting Traineeship Opportunity!
 Work local, go global - Get the IT skills to take you anywhere
 2023 Commencement!

 The NSW Government is offering Year 12 school leavers and career changers an opportunity to apply for a NSW Information Technology (IT)Traineeship in Cyber Security. You can become a valued cyber security professional with industry experience, industry specific training and formal qualifications. During this 24-month program, trainees will complete a Certificate IV in Cyber Security while undertaking paid employment rotations across NSW Government.
 This is a unique opportunity to kick-start your cyber security career while being supported through mentoring, bootcamps and networking activities.
 You will be exposed to a variety of cyber security roles within NSW Government, such as policy, intelligence, security operations, incident response, and vulnerability management.
 This two-year traineeship program combines a formal qualification, industry recognised certification and practical experience working with NSW Government agencies.

 What you'll be doing…
 You will complete a Certificate IV In Cyber Security over 24 months through a combination of formal training and on-the-job experience with your Host Employer.
 This unique combination of formal education and work experience will give you the opportunity to work in Cybersecurity, working with NSW Government Agencies. Duties may include -

 protecting systems, networks and programs from digital attacks
 perform basic cybersecurity data analysis
 Implement network security infrastructure for an organisation
 Manage the security infrastructure for an organisation
 Analyse and present resarch information
 Development and testing of incident response plans

 What are the benefits…

 Two years full-time paid work, while studying 1 day per week
 Nationally recognised Certificate IV qualification from a registered training organisation Tafe NSW
 Industry co-designed, innovative vendor specific training, in partnership with the new Institute of Applied Technology (IAT)
 Vital workplace experience you can carry anywhere
 A laptop to support your studies and development of technical skills for the duration of the traineeship
 A competitive annual salary for the duration of the program
 Work-integrated learning and nothing to pay for your qualification.


 What's in it for me?
 Being a HVTC Group trainee opens the door to working for industry leaders via our close connections with major local employers.
 As a HVTC Group trainee you have ongoing job security! Our network of Host Employers means we can offer rotations to ensure you can fulfill your education and training requirements; Become qualified without getting yourself into debt and actually start earning an income!
 Throughout your traineeship, you will be able to take advantage of our exclusive employee benefits, which include:

 One-on-one coaching and development from a dedicated mentor
 Individual and group safety training with our team of experts
 Discounted health insurance
 Discounted gym memberships
 Alumni program to support you post qualification
 Reward and recognition programs
 Commbank Workplace Banking Program to give you financial advice (and retail discounts!)
 Health and Wellbeing initiatives, campaigns, and competitions through HVTC's Committee (there might even be some prizes up for grabs!).
 24/7 confidential counselling through our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) provider

 Who you'll be working with…
 HVTC Group is an expert in the employment and training of apprentices and trainees. We believe skills change lives and that apprenticeships and traineeships can open doors to incredible careers. This is why we partner with businesses to match the right person with the right career.
 During your traineeship, you'll be employed by us, while completing on-the-job training with one of our Host Employer Agencies working with the NSW Government. We'll provide you with ongoing mentoring and support to help you achieve your career goals and unleash your true potential.
 So, what are you waiting for?!
 What you'll bring to the table…
 To make the most of this opportunity you will:

 Be eligible for enrolment in the Certificate IV in Cyber Security. Please refer to the TAFE NSW website for further details Certificate IV in Cyber Security
 be genuinely passionate about technology and driven to build a career in cyber security
 Demonstrate an interest in cyber security, and a basic understanding of networking, operating systems and security concepts
 have verbal and written communication skills
 have the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
 be committed to your formal and 'on the job' training for 24 months
 have a can-do attitude and be an enthusiastic learner
 Be an Australian citizen.

 Note: Candidates will be required to obtain a Baseline Security Clearance. Further information about the vetting process and required materials is available here: Baseline Security Clearance. We strongly encourage candidates to prepare their materials in advance, as they will be required to submit their clearance applications upon commencing the program.
 While remote working will be supported, candidates may be required to work in the office location of their designated agency or department. If you are unable to travel within Greater Sydney during the traineeship, please note this in your application.
 ** Applicants already holding a Cert IV in Cyber Security, or a Diploma or University qualification in IT, are not eligible for the Cyber Security Cert IV traineeship **
 What to do next...
 To apply for this role, click the ' for this job' button and then follow the steps to complete your application. You can also apply online at www.hvtc.com.au by clicking on 'Vacancies' and selecting the relevant position, then the ' Online' button at the top of the page.
 All applications require a resume (no longer than two pages) and cover letter (one page) outlining:

 your interest and or background in cyber security, including any specific areas of interest
 why you would be an ideal candidate for this program.

 What else is involved?
 After submitting your online application, you may be invited to complete online testing, interviews and pre-employment medicals. We may also contact your references. Please be sure to check your emails (including your junk folder) and respond to missed phone calls, voicemail messages and text messages.
 Your resident expert for this opportunity will be Michael Schipp, you can contact Michael for a confidential conversation on 02 4932 4184.
 Applications close 31st October 2022
 As a recognised Diversity Champion HVTC are committed to Equal Employment Opportunities, Ethical Practices, and the principles of Cultural Diversity. We encourage applications from all members of the community, including people from indigenous backgrounds, women seeking non-traditional trade opportunities and mature aged people.

Category: Public Sector Industry - Local Government

Date Posted: 25/08/2022

Graduate – Cyber Security Engineer
 SNC-Lavalin is one of the world’s leading professional services and project management organisations since 1911 with over 30,000 employees worldwide. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects across the world. We are committed to having a diverse, flexible, and inclusive team that drives and shapes our business and we are proud to create opportunities for enthusiastic individuals looking to build their careers in Australia and globally.
 SNC-Lavalin is growing rapidly in Australia with new project wins offering exciting opportunities to learn and develop. With a strong reputation in the rail sector, we are expanding our service offering.
 Our regional business servicing the Australia & New Zealand markets is divided into three sectors including Consulting and Advisory, Program & Project management and Design & Engineering.
 Your purpose is our progress.
 We’re not all the same, and that’s our greatest strength. Different views and opinions enhance our ability to provide value-added performance and better services for our clients. That’s why we believe different, makes a difference.
 Our 18 months graduate program has been designed to give you an insight into the variety of opportunities on offer across our business and the chance to explore where your own specific skills and interests lie. Through a combination of on-the-job learning and practical skills development within your chosen role, you’ll work on real projects from day one that offer scale and variety collaborating with others and creating meaningful impact on the world around us.
 As a Graduate Cyber Security Engineer you will gain exposure to practical experience with Industrial Control Systems (ICS), SCADA, Operational Technology (OT) environments and develop a strong understanding of key cyber security controls that are implements across those systems and environments.
 Join us to make a difference that matters!
 We’re on the lookout for the brightest minds to take up vital roles in shaping some of our exciting projects such as Cross River Rail, Inland Rail, Sydney Harbour Tunnel, New Western Harbour Tunnel Next Generation, Integration and Delivery Partner – Sydney Metro, Sydney’s Barangaroo Ferry Hub, Project Energy Connect and more!
 About you:

 Currently in your final year of Bachelor of Engineering – Systems Engineering / Cyber Security
 High attention to detail.
 Intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Office (MS Word & MS Excel).
 Confident approach to problem solving.
 Positive ‘can-do’ attitude.
 Ability to successfully manage multiple priorities with various stakeholders.
 Ability to work independently and within a team environment.

 Note: The opportunity is available in Sydney, Brisbane and Melbourne.
 Please contact Graduates.au@atkinsglobal.com for any queries or support.
 Our deadline for applications is Sunday, 18th September 2022.
 We weave Equality, Diversity & Inclusion into everything we do.
 We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community - a place where we can all be ourselves, thrive and develop. To help embed inclusion for all, from day one, we offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from different backgrounds. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.

An excellent opportunity has become available for a highly motivated and passionate Cyber Security Customer Enablement Specialist to join the Security Operations Team in either Melbourne or Sydney.

 The opportunity:
 The Cyber Security Customer Enablement Specialist is responsible for the smooth onboarding of customers to the Cyber Detection & Response service. They are responsible for ongoing and continuous customer engagements, including service delivery elements outside of security incidents and, assist the Security Customer Enablement Manager as the contact point for new bids requiring assistance from TSOC staff.

 Please note all candidates must be Australian Citizens and be eligible to attain a minimum of NV1 AGSVA security clearance to be considered. This role will require you to hold and maintain a Negative Vetting 1 (NV1) security clearance.

 Your key responsibilities and major tasks include, but are not limited to: 

Responsible for the success of the E2E customer operational onboarding process after sales team handover through prioritisation of the customer onboarding backlog, and engagement with customers to ensure Telstra meets all contractual requirements.
 Through continuous and regular BAU customer engagement, drive identification, validation, qualification and planning of key initiatives for improvement of customer experience.
 Support stakeholder engagement across all Telstra lines of business where necessary to enable better customer and Telstra outcomes.
 Work with the Product & Technology Product Managers and assist with the TSOC operations team input into sourcing new technologies or opportunities for technology improvement within the market. (Seek out and discover new technologies that meet future customer needs, organise and conduct POC’s/MVP’s and feasibility studies to provide Telstra with the best options analysis)
 Assist with customer pre-sales meetings as required where operational input or perspective is required to ensure Telstra success.
 Assist colleagues to enhance their cyber security knowledge and skillsets.
 Assist in the development and improvement of documentation that supports the business unit.
 Perform other tasks as directed by management.


 Enough about us, let's talk about you. To hit the ground running we are looking for individuals who can confidently demonstrate the following:

 Be eligible to obtain an NV1 Security Clearance 
Demonstrated understanding of Information Security concepts
 Comfortable with an iterative development mindset (DevOps)
 Experience working within a team-based environment and demonstrated “Team Player” attitude
 Working understanding of security monitoring outcomes through understanding of design and implementation of Security Use Cases and Detections
 Ability to work with and direct teams outside their line of management
 Cloud Virtualisation experience, Azure and AWS or similar

 Highly Desirable:

 Past experience in a customer facing service delivery or customer service role for a medium to large enterprise providing managed services.
 Knowledge of, or experience in big data technologies (HDFS, NoSQL, Pig, Hive, Kafka, HBase, NIFI, Storm, Ambari or related)


 Our perks & benefits:

 Work-life integration - we understand life happens when you're busy making other plans, so we offer flexibility around where, and when you work.
 16 weeks paid parental leave for primary and secondary carers.
 Professional development program.
 An epic (free) Telstra mobile phone plan.
 Laptop/Device allowance renewed every 2 years.
 Purchased Annual Leave scheme.
 Discounted Telstra products and services.


 We fully embrace flexibility and choice at Telstra and it’s as unique as you. We believe every role can flex in some way and encourage you to work where, when, and how you are most engaged, safe, and productive. Talk to us about how a role could be flexible for you!

 This role requires the successful candidate to be vaccinated against Covid-19, to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people and customers. However, please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances.

 On the cusp of the next technological transformation in the digital world, Telstra has and continues to be at the forefront of local and global innovation. Come disrupt and lead the industry as we build the networks for the future and push the boundaries of what’s possible with technology.

 We're after the right blend of experience and enthusiasm and look for cultural add, rather than cultural fit. We benefit from the unique gifts and backgrounds of each person in our business and push for diversity of thought in all we do.

Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
 


   About the Role:
 

   As part of the Falcon Complete Cadetship Program, you’ll make a difference in global security by protecting organisations against the most advanced attackers in the world. Our CrowdStrike virtual security operations centre offers opportunities to expand your skill set through a wide variety of experiences, such as detecting and responding to incidents as they occur in real-time whilst also managing customer email interactions, ranging from policy changes through to detection explanations and much more…
 


   *** Please note a Cover Letter is required as part of the application process ***
 


   Highlights:
 



     February - July 2023 accelerator training program
   


     Full- time fixed term contract
   


     Fully remote training
   


     Possible conversion to permanent employment with a Six-Figure Package!
   



   What You'll Get:

     Networking opportunities with fellow Grads/Interns and other CrowdStrikers
   


     Working alongside a diverse and global team

     Paid holidays and much more…
   



   What You'll Do:

     Escalate alerts that indicate a potential security incident.
   


     Serve as our first line of contact for customer requests.
   


     Initiate cases, document activities, and escalate issues to higher-level security analysts per Falcon Complete Standard Operating Procedures.
   


     Handle high pressure situations in a productive and professional manner.
   



   What You’ll Need:
 



     Relevant incident handling skills (not essential but preferred)
   


     Fundamental understanding of information security
   


     Fundamental understanding of sysinternals
   


     Fundamental understanding of network communications
   


     Desire to grow a career in Cyber Security and expand technical/soft skills (essential)
   


     Recent Graduate or current student working towards a BA or BS / MA or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Information Security, Information Assurance, Information Security Management, Intelligence Studies, Cybersecurity, Cybersecurity Policy, or a related field.
   



   *** Please note a Cover Letter is required as part of the application process ***
 


   Bonus Points:
 

   Successful candidates could have experience in one or more of the following areas:
 



     Languages: Native or Bilingual Proficiency in both Japanese and English
   


     Incident Handling
   


     Computer Forensic Analysis
   


     Systems Administration
   


     Network Forensic Analysis
   


     Incident Remediation

   Here’s what our previous interns have to say about our program:
 




      The CrowdStrike Internship Experience
     (video)
   


     Our feature on 
    
     The Internship Show
     (podcast)
   



   #LI-CM1
 

   #LI-Remote
 



    We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.
  



   CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

WHO WE ARE
 Optiver is a tech-driven trading firm and leading global market maker. For over 35 years, Optiver has been improving financial markets worldwide, making them more transparent and efficient for all participants. With more than 1,400 employees in offices around the world, we're united in our commitment to improving the market through competitive pricing, execution and thorough risk management. By providing liquidity on multiple exchanges across the world, we actively trade on 70+ exchanges, where we're trusted to always provide accurate buy and sell pricing – no matter the market conditions.
  WHAT YOU'LL DO
 Operating in 70+ exchanges around the world, we are building our Security team to take control of our cybersecurity and help our business stay ahead of emerging threats across our offices. As a Windows Security Engineer, you will join our global security team in our fast-paced Sydney office to help protect our data, infrastructure, and operations. You will get the chance to take ownership of our cybersecurity controls to ensure our defence always remains up to the task.
 You will have the opportunity to combine your knowledge of IT infrastructure, project management and a problem-solving mindset to solve business issues and independently work on improvement opportunities. This is a highly collaborative position, you will be involved in a variety of tasks such as security operations and engineering, risk analysis and security governance. Other responsibilities include:

Develop and use monitoring tools to protect our systems, as well as perform security incident response and remediation when an issue is found.
Take ownership of operational issues, as well as project-based work, where you will act as a lead engineer to deliver from conception through to completion.
Work on security-related user requests and serve as point of escalation for the user support team.
Be part of a flexible rotating on-call roster to support our global operation.



 WHO YOU ARE
 Optiver needs our next Windows Security Engineer to be someone with:

5+ years of experience working in a Windows Infrastructure Engineering role or Security Engineering specific role with background in Windows.
An interest in cybersecurity events and research, with a strong engineering instinct and a deep understanding of both technical and business problems.
Automation scripting experience in Python or PowerShell.
Experience with Microsoft Infrastructure such as Active Directory, PKI, DNS, GPOs.
Experience in securing Windows platforms, servers, and desktops such as managing firewalls, disk encryption, auditing, monitoring and event logging.
Exposure to endpoint security controls such as AV, EDR, Vulnerability Scanning and Patch Management.
Knowledge in common OS attack vectors, system hardening, and secure privilege escalation.
Experience delivering projects end to end individually and in a team environment, from initiation to implementation.



 WHAT YOU'LL GET

The chance to work alongside diverse, intelligent, and driven peers in a rewarding environment.
We offer competitive remuneration, including: an attractive bonus structure and additional leave entitlements.
Training, mentorship, and personal development opportunities.
Gym membership plus weekly chair massages.
Daily breakfast, lunch and an in-house barista.
Regular social events including an annual company trip.
A work-from-home allowance and support.
Guided relocation, a competitive relocation package and visa sponsorship where necessary.



 As an intentionally flat organisation, we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included, valued, and respected, because we believe our best work is done together.
 Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

Role: Security Engineer Location: Sydney + Hybrid Division: Engineering

Recommend solutions and be part of their implementation
Scope to specialise in a few areas 
Have your ideas heard and acted on
Part of a boutique firm, nimble enough to move with the times
Long-term clients to see your impact over time

About The Role
 You will plan and implement security solutions to address client needs, risks and objectives. No two days will be alike, being exposed to multiple client environments, technology stacks, industries and applications. 
The role will report to the engineering lead. The team is comprised of highly skilled and motivated security professionals, that are focused on helping organisations achieve their strategic information security objectives through hands-on engineering and related activities.
 Experience in a similar consultancy role is desirable although not a requirement, however given this is a client facing role excellent communications skills are essential. We will build on your strong technical background, encouraging you to explore new approaches or technologies to solving traditional problems. 
About You
 You are capable of much more than your current responsibilities permit due to the organisational structure, feeling like a small fish in a large pond. You emotional intelligence, broad technical experience, work ethic and entrepreneurial nature makes the move to a boutique up-and-comer a logical next step in your career, where they can make their mark, have your voice and ideas heard and play an instrumental part in a future success story.
 Ideal Characteristics


Technical competence in multiple enterprise ICT areas such as Windows Domains, networking, Microsoft 365 security capabilities, Azure and AWS, SIEM/SOC/threat detection, forensics, identify and access control, vulnerability management of traditional and modern architectures such as containers and serverless computing.

Experience in a managed security services provider.
Some experience on the client side of working with outsourced cyber security providers.



About us
 Not all cybersecurity consultancies are alike. At Security Centric, we know that supporting you, what you value, and the way that you like to work is an integral part of making sure you're going to love what you do - just like we do.  Whether it's the importance of being a part of a high performing team, the flexibility to work from where you want, a desire for contribution that's not restrictive to one aspect of cybersecurity and business, or a desire for continual learning and improvement combined with guidance, our individual-focused values will ensure you're given opportunities to grow, all while providing exceptional cybersecurity services to our clients and partners.   Founded 11 years ago, our purpose is to provide business leaders with peach of mind with regards to cyber security though providing an Australian-based team of consultants and skilled engineers that act as an internal, outsourced, information security team.   We have long term engagements and partner with our clients which means we don’t delivery transactional pieces of work. This means you not only get the variety of working with a consulting firm, but you are able to see the results of your work as our clients' organisations grow.  Our people and culture is important, which is why we invest in our team members and provide benefits such as a recognition program, doona days, and additional annual leave.
 This role is based in Sydney and will have a mixture of office working, home working and some travel to client sites.

Are you a Cyber Security professional seeking a new challenge?
 The Information Management unit is seeking a Cyber Security Analyst to ensure the secure operation and monitoring of the City’s computer systems, servers and network connections. 
You will support day to day cyber security activities, monitor, assess and respond to security threats and establish, maintain and enhance the cyber security posture of all City’s information and operational technologies. You will develop, implement, maintain and enhance the IT security baseline including standards, processes and controls for all aspects of IT infrastructure and operations. You will also champion change in the City to improve IT security and actively contribute to the ongoing education of end users in the secure use of City IT systems. 
To be successful in this role you will have demonstrated relevant experience and a detailed understanding of IT security practices with highly developed skills in fault identification, root cause analysis and problem resolution. Demonstrated relevant experience in fundamental/first-response Digital Forensics and Incident Response with experience in identifying and implementing process improvements are essential for this role. 
If you hold a tertiary qualification with several years of subsequent relevant experience in information technology, computer science or similar, we welcome your application. Relevant industry certification in security practice or controls is highly desirable. 
We offer remote working (up to 2 days per week), flexible employment arrangements including options for part time work and rostered days off plus generous leave provisions and learning and development opportunities.
 A satisfactory police records check is required for this position.
 If you require any further information regarding this position, including details on remote working options or flexible work arrangements please contact Kale Beesley, Coordinator Infrastructure and Security on 0428 366 069.
 Please submit your cover letter, outlining why you are interested in this position and detailing your relevant experience with your current CV/resume by close of business Tuesday September 6, 2022. 
The City of Greater Bendigo is a proactive, flexible and dynamic employer, delivering more than 100 services to the community. The City is an equal opportunity employer, supportive of flexible working arrangements and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people of diverse cultural and religious backgrounds, gender identities, sexual orientations and of all ages and abilities. The City is a Child Safe employer.

Your Role:
As our Cyber Security Specialist and under the stewardship of our Head of Cyber Security, you will be responsible for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity and availability of GBAU’s and client information assets. The team works closely with our clients ensuring that their cyber security requirements are built into solutions and applications. There will also be synergy with the regional and global security teams ensuring that corporate security goals are met.
You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following: 

Leading/contributing to key projects which support internal and external stakeholders
Provide security advice and guidance during development stages and system lifecycle of solutions.
Execute incident management procedures including monitoring and managing all local security breaches and handling of security incidents, root cause analysis and impact, taking appropriate action to prevent recurrence wherever possible
Developing and continually improving security controls to ensure that systems and services remain protected and available for all business units.
Ensure standards and guidelines are continuously evolving to consider new and emerging cyber security risks, new technologies and regulatory requirements.

About us  At Sydney Trains our vision is to keep Sydney moving by putting the customer at the centre of everything we do. We work at the heart of local communities and integrate cutting edge technology to deliver efficient rail services which exceed expectations and support a rapidly growing economy. Sydney Trains also operate the Rail Operations Centre and are responsible for the maintenance of assets including tracks, trains, signals, overhead wiring, stations and facilities. We conduct our operations in the community in compliance with the principles of ecologically sustainable development.
Our Operational Technology Unit within Network Maintenance is responsible for ensuring high availability and reliability of Control Systems, Wireless and Fixed voice and data networks, Condition Monitoring and Passenger Information infrastructure and Cyber Security of Operational Systems.


The opportunity


Right now, we have an opportunity for a Specialist, Third Party Security to join us in the Operational Technology Unit to lead the way in ensuring cyber security risks are appropriately managed for our operational systems.


What you will be involved in:



Working with and conducting security assessments of all Third Parties and contractors.
Working with Procurement teams on Request for Proposals (RFP) and contracts and advising on security issues
Planning and conducting risk assessments of third parties with regards to their cyber security capabilities and maturity, with reference to ISO27001 and Cyber Security Management System (CSMS) framework
Preparing and presenting third party and supply chain cyber risk reports and attestations to management, key committees, and other relevant stakeholders
Developing risk remediation plans to address identified third party risks, working with security, technical and procurement teams


 
About you  You are tertiary qualified in a relevant Engineering, Technology or Cyber Security discipline with an understanding of IEC 62443 and ISO 27001 standards, looking for an opportunity that will give you exposure help shape Sydney Trains cyber security strategy.
Your strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills will ensure your ability to present highly technical information in an understandable manner, and then influence a variety of stakeholders to follow the required cyber security standards that will in effect drive improvement and change.
Ideally, you will also have a strong grasp of Cyber Security and Operational Technology and a demonstrated understanding of managing interface issues between various technical, production and operational disciplines.
You will have a strong understanding of cyber security risk management and the various cyber security standards and demonstrated experience conducting risk assessments of third parties with regards to their cyber security capabilities and maturity. Cyber Security and/or Risk Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, and CRISC, will be highly regarded.
