About the Role
 An exciting opportunity to join BOQ Group (which includes Bank of Queensland, ME Bank and Virgin Money Australia) has arrived! As a Cyber Security Assurance Analyst, you will be joining BOQ Group during our transformation journey to be the digital bank of the future. This permanent role will enable you to add significant value to our organisation by assisting with cyber security risk assessments for the business, allowing you to make a difference whilst acting with integrity and empathy. With exciting projects currently underway, you will be a key contributor to unique business development and change across BOQ Group.
 You will join a high performing team to assist with third party cyber security assessments to provide assurance over the complex vendor partner environment. In addition to these assessments, you will deliver cyber security risk assessment reports that outline business context, assets at risk, threat community, description of identified risks aligned in 4A IT risk categories (including cause factors and potential business impact) and more. You will also track the pipeline of third-party cyber security assessments to ensure efficient delivery. 
This is a challenging and exciting role with a wide range of technical development opportunities and a variety of training to assist in your career development. BOQ Group has invested heavily in cutting-edge security tools to respond to the dynamic global security landscape and support our business' long-term objectives. 

About you
 As a collaborative security risk professional, you must be able to work as part of a team and under limited supervision, inhibiting a can-do attitude, good communication and the drive to learn within our supportive environment.
 You will understand risk, controls and cybersecurity frameworks (i.e., NIST RMF, NIST CSF, ISO 27005, COBIT, RiskIT or 4A IT Risk) as well as asset-level controls and risk mitigation tools (i.e., Firewalls, WAF, DDoS, SIEM, IAM or DLP) to help assess the overall security posture of technical controls in the solution or system. 
Furthermore, you will have a deep understanding of current and emerging laws and regulations affecting the Australian financial sector and other jurisdictions such as APRA, Privacy Act, SOX, GDPR, Mandatory Breach Disclosure and NY DFS Cybersecurity regulations. 

About Us
 BOQ is one of Australia’s leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers, shareholders and people through empathy, integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank; with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.
 BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.
 BOQ’s Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.
 In 2021 BOQ Group was awarded a Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality citation.
 Our Benefits


Flexible working arrangements
Discounted financial products
Salary sacrificing options
Paid parental leave with no minimum
Paid volunteer days
Purchase annual leave
BUPA Corporate Plan
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
A ‘zero tolerance’ to Domestic and Family Violence (DFV) with active support for employees experiencing DFV
Accessible work support through various practices, systems, office adjustments
Gym, shopping, technology and travel offers
5 employee diversity network groups focusing on; First Nations Reconciliation Council, Proudly ME (LGBTIQA+), Multicultural, Gender and Early Career.
BOQ Group is a member of Pride in Diversity and a participating organisation in the Australian Workplace Equality Index.


How to Apply
 To apply for this role please follow the links or apply via our Careers Page.
 The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.
 If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.
 Job Reference: BOQ01304

Our business is growing, and so is our team. In this newly defined position, we’re looking for a Cyber Security Analyst who thrives in a fast-paced environment, is a self-starter and driven by high quality outcomes.
  
 The Role You Could Play
  
 The Cyber Security Analyst will carry out security measures to monitor and protect sensitive data and systems from infiltration and cyber-attacks. You will help drive the cyber security strategy to ensure safeguards are in place to protect our computer networks and systems. This role will work across IT and non-IT team members and report directly to the Cyber Security Lead.
 

 As MECCA continues to invest in our Cyber Resilience Program to stay on top of the ever-changing cyber security landscape, this role will drive MECCA’s security governance by tracking, assessing and prioritising cyber risks. The successful candidate will collaborate with internal teams to develop and track actionable tasks and projects to mitigate these risks.
  
 As the cyber security domain rapidly evolves, the Cyber Security Analyst should be keen on keeping abreast of new cyber threats, responses, and technologies. The role will work alongside various IT departments of MECCA, including Application Services, Project Delivery, Software Engineering, Architecture, Infrastructure & Operations, and non-IT areas.
  
 What You Will Bring
 

 This role will require a strong multi-tasker with a keen eye for detail. In addition to these general skills and personality traits, MECCA is seeking an individual with the following skills:
 

 Direct experience with enterprise security tools like next-gen AV, endpoint detection and response (EDR), next-gen firewalls, website and email filtering
 Experience as core member of security operations or information security function for an enterprise business
 Experience in security by design, controls testing, and operations
 Knowledge of disaster recovery, business continuity, and incident response procedures
 Experience designing and developing security policies, standards, and procedures
 Ability to communicate security issues to IT peers, non-IT, and management
 Quick learning capability and ability to pick-up new technologies and explore them
 Good teamwork skill and strong communication to work with IT stakeholders, Suppliers, and
 Sound knowledge working with security standards and frameworks such as NIST CSF, Essential 8, and ISO27001
 Should be familiar and basic understanding of networks, web and mobile applications, cloud computing models (IaaS, SaaS, Paas), and DevOps concepts
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of people and technologies


 Your life at MECCA
 

 Whilst we are singularly focused on our #CustomerFirst mantra, we know that wouldn’t be possible without an incredible team that is guided by our MECCA values and motivated each and every day to be solutions focused, innovative, collaborative and adaptable, and have a bit of fun along the way!
 

 Some of our other team member benefits include:
 

 Professional development programs and first-class digitised learning offering
 Health and well-being initiatives
 Reward and recognition programs
 Access to bonus and incentive programs
 Quarterly product allowance
 Unlimited 40% discount


 There are also so many other ways in which you’ll be made to feel part of the MECCA story as we love to celebrate, surprise and delight our team along the way.

 Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best. 
Rewards platform - your hard work won't go unnoticed at Deloitte. 
Training and development - at Deloitte we believe in investing in our best assets, the people! You will have access to world class training and funding towards industry and other professional certifications. 

 About our team 

 Our Cyber Intelligence Centre (CIC) provides 24x7 cyber monitoring, threat intelligence, cyber analytics, threat hunting, cyber incident response, and several other managed security services. The Sydney CIC is part of a global network of over 30 Deloitte cyber intelligence centres globally. 

 About the Role 

 As a Security operations specialist you are a Deloitte appointed SME responsible for day-to-day management and maintenance of key security controls within our client environments, and ensuring these controls are configured to detect, prevent, and report security events. You will be responsible for managing security devices and systems such as Palo Alto PRISMA, Palo Alto NGFW, EDR Solutions such as Defender ATP and CrowdStrike. Security operations specialists will also assist with investigation of cyber security incidents and providing security inputs to day-to-day IT operations teams. 

 We’re looking for someone with strong analytical and problem-solving skills who can deliver effective solutions in a timely manner. The candidate will have previous hands-on experience working in engineering or security device management roles and should bring an open mind to take on business problems and develop technical solutions with a focus on automation. 

 About your experience 

 Manage Palo Alto Prisma cloud security posture compliance. This includes security policy configuration, integration for alert forwarding and monthly reporting on alert trends and findings. 
Manage Palo Alto cloud based virtual firewalls in Azure. This includes security policy management, ruleset management, integration with SIEM and the SOC for security alert forwarding and monthly reporting on alert trends and findings. 
Vulnerability management to analyse findings from Prisma and security team vulnerability reports, assist with risk assessments on the vulnerabilities and coordinate remediation and patching activities with Deloitte Cloud resolver groups and system owners. Highlight areas where vulnerability management can be improved. 
Coordinate risk acceptance from stakeholders where required if vulnerabilities cannot be remediated or work arounds are required. 
Respond to security incident tickets raised by the SOC and assist with incident investigation. 
A strong understanding of security event investigation, incident management and SOC operating models. 
Experience with Coding/Scripting or development would be highly desirable 
Experience with Azure would be highly desirable 
Understanding of cyber-attack tactics, techniques, and procedures 
Technical experience in general information security best practices, TCP/IP networking and routing fundamentals, unix/linux system administration, network troubleshooting, intrusion detection/prevention. 
An individual with excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
An individual willing to taking on new challenges, gain new skills and work collaboratively in a dynamic and rapidly growing team. 

 Why Deloitte? 
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. 

 The minimum salary requirement for this role is $80,000 inclusive of 10.5% superannuation. 

 Next steps 

 If you're interested in this role, please 'apply now'. #RA/FA #LI-DN 

 By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally. 

 At Deloitte, we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another; prioritise respect, fairness, development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request. 

 The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

The Company

 Sigma Bravo – A KBR Company is a specialist ICT services provider focused specifically on military operations, aviation mission planning software and information management. We maintain an unparalleled reputation for working in partnership with our clients to integrate, support and inform Australian Defence Force operations. Sigma Bravo provides support throughout Australia, proactively working to enhance operational capabilities.

 The Role

 The Cyber Security Analyst is responsible to the MPS Network Operations Manager to provide technical support for the secure MPS supported by Sigma Bravo. This role was added as part of CCP04 to the current SB/JC2SPO MPS Sustainment Support Contract. It is a second of the Security Specialist roles to enable completion of project support requirements for JC2SPO & Air Warfare Centre (RAAF).

 Required Qualifications: 


Qualifications and/or experience in network administration / IT systems
 1-5 years Information Technology experience
 CompTIA Security +
 GIAC Foundations – Computers, Technology, & Security (GFACT)
 ISACA CSX Cybersecurity Fundamentals
 Microsoft Technology Associate (MTA) Security Fundamentals


 Key Responsibilities: 

Technical support to the development, introduction to service, sustainment and evolution of software and hardware, data, tools and processes in fixed and deployed environments for ADF mission planning systems.
 Technical support to the development of solutions to resolve issues with data support for MPS.
 Develop, manage, and maintain systems configuration for MPS laptops.
 Installing, configuring, testing and deploying software.
 Provide effective support to ensure all mission systems are working and meet the operational needs of users
 Provide support on Defence strategic networks
 Technical support to the security and accreditation of MPS
 Identifying and managing program and technical risks and issues within the support to operations scope.
 Reviewing, verifying, and improving documentation produced in support of MPS development and sustainment.
 Meet assigned task within Project deliverables
 Basic to Intermediate skills in SIEM operation, as an analyst ideally on Splunk;
 Experience running queries to follow a chain of events through multiple indexes or other sources
 Attack surface mapping, critical vulnerability triage and impact analysis of MPS systems
 Basic understanding of basic incident response techniques including initial and detailed investigation, computer forensics, chain of custody implications, working within authorised boundaries, malware analysis, etc
 Monitor developments in MPS applications, systems, database, and network fields to ensure that matters of security and privacy are suitably planned and catered for
 Participate in the implementation of security administration controls and measures to mitigate risk.
 Monitor the activities of system users for compliance with policy
 Support in the development, and maintenance of security configurations of MPS systems
 Well-developed writing skills and experience maintaining technical documentation

 career paths.

Job Description:
 DXC Technology (NYSE:DXC) - where brilliant people embrace change and seize opportunities to advance their careers and amplify customer success.

 People are the heart of our business. We support each other and work as a team, globally and locally to deliver excellence for our customers and colleagues. We live in more than 70 countries, speak multiple languages and work with over 6,000 customers on almost every continent. We use the power of technology to deliver mission critical IT services that move the world. DXC.com

 We welcome applications from suitably qualified applicants across Australia. DXC is also committed to its ‘Virtual First’ initiative with remote and flexible work arrangement opportunities.

 Key Responsibilities:

 Participates in the development of business security solutions and strategy for targeted/assigned customers of a smaller size and less complexity while assisting senior sales solutions personnel in larger efforts. Develops industry expertise to assist in providing in-depth solutions architecture capability based on specific customer's business needs. Identifies and integrates holistic security solutions from both business and technical perspective, taking into account all variables and constraints such as costs, contract terms, business conditions and the technical environment of the client.
 Researches customer and related industry to understand customer and business security issues. Establishes and cultivates relationships with client demonstrating an understanding of business challenges within customer markets and how company technology-enabled business solutions can address those needs.
 Provides strategic guidance to pursuit teams for assigned customers during the security solution development process to ensure alignment with overall company sales and client business strategy. Collaborates with senior sales solutions experts and develops technical operating strategies and security solutions, and benefits. Analyzes stakeholders, identifies and recognizes prospect traits and determines how to effectively influence their decision.
 Participates in the delivery and process of selling the technical security solution strategy and vision to clients. Ensures the solution incorporates company win philosophies, themes and key differentiators while meeting client expectations and requirements thereby providing the best opportunity to compete and win.
 Analyzes existing industry, market and IT (information technology) security services best practices and trends as well as alliances to evaluate and ensure company solutions and services are meeting the needs of clients. Works with senior team members to leverage partner solutions to find ways to address customer needs.
 Assists and serves as a resource to ensure that the business solutions and strategies align with the client's business goals and current/potential standards.


 Qualifications and Experience:

 Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
 Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, security information technology or related security certifications preferred
 6 or more years of business solutions, technical consulting, or sales solutions experience
 Experience working with government agencies.
 Experience working with technology products, services, competencies, solutions and offerings
 Experience working with solution/product portfolios
 Experience working with business environment, business industry and competitor products and services
 Good verbal and written communication skills to persuade others through presentations, demonstration and written communication
 Good communication skills to listen to client and articulate back for solutioning
 Good interpersonal and presentation skills for interacting with team members and prospective clients
 Ability to create and maintain formal and informal networks
 Ability to publicly represent company with internal and external clients
 Ability to use own judgment and initiative in problem resolution
 Ability to articulate and present the business value of company solutions
 Ability to present ideas, goals, problems, outcomes and processes to be understood by a diverse audience


 Our culture and benefits: DXC is committed to building better futures for our customers, colleagues, environment, and communities. We take care of each other and foster a culture of inclusion, belonging and corporate citizenship. We put this to action developing and implementing societal initiatives within our Social Impact Practice. #WeAreDXC

 As an employer of choice, our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration, benefits, training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees, and the communities in which we live and work. Some of these include;


 Extensive resources to support your onboarding and continual development including DXC University

How will I help? 
As an Information Security Consultant in the Security Service Enablement and Delivery team, you will help facilitate the mature operation of critical technology controls. 
This role helps ensure that key elements of service delivery are maintained across a broad range of information security capabilities. 
This is an excellent role for a candidate with a business or information technology background, looking to take their first role in cybersecurity. You will work in a fast-paced environment alongside subject matter experts who utilise market leading tools to protect the bank and its customers. 

What’s in it for me? 
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure. 

What do I need? 
To be successful in this role, you will have prior experience in any of the following disciplines, information security, information technology, risk management, or service delivery. 
Ideally, you will have an understanding of ITSM practices, such as ITIL and knowledge in business, financial, forecasting, contracts or risks. 

What’s it like to work there? 
As well as competitive remuneration and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. 
We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. 
As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion. 

How do I Apply?
 
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply. 
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces. 
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy , and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

 Minor Hotels is an international hotel owner, operator and investor, currently with a diverse portfolio of over 530 properties. Through our Anantara, Avani, Elewana, Oaks, NH Hotels, NH Collection, nhow and TIVOLI properties, Minor Hotels operates in 50+ countries across Asia Pacific, the Middle East, Africa, the Indian Ocean, Europe and South America.
 Minor Hotels AU & NZ is a proud leader in strata titled accommodation management with numerous Hotels, Resorts and Residential Apartment buildings throughout Australia and New Zealand.



 Job Description
  We are currently seeking a diligent, professional Data Security & Privacy Officer to join our team full-time. The Data Security and Privacy Officer will play a key role in managing Corporate Compliance with respect to Data Privacy and Security within the MH ANZ region. The Data Security & Privacy Officer reports to MH ANZ Group Director of IT and will be a part of Global Minor Data Protection Committee to represent MH ANZ.
 Duties and responsibilities

 Implement key IT security and privacy policies, procedures, and processes.
 Assist Business Owners to meet MH ANZ Group obligations.
 Provide 1st & 2nd line of compliance reviews and monitoring activities.
 Support data privacy training, awareness, and communication activities.
 Liaise with the Minor Hotels privacy compliance functions.
 Reporting to Data Protection committees and keeping of minutes, if required.
 Timely prescribed and ad hoc reporting.
 Support and undertake Minor Group data privacy and protection projects and training initiatives.
 Provide consultative support in the implementation of (risk mitigating) strategies and campaigns and assist with the coordination of any associated procedures in relation to new products, services or campaigns.
 Report and escalate risk and data privacy related concerns, issues, and failures.




 Qualifications
  What makes a successful Data Privacy Officer?

 A Bachelor level qualification or cybersecurity experience in a medium to large enterprises environment.
 2+ years’ experience with privacy and security frameworks .
 Familiar with compliance standards such as NIST CSF, ISO 27001, PCI-DSS.
 Experience in the preparation of reports, procedures, strategy, and related documents.
 Experience with assessing and developing enterprise-wide policies and procedures for IT risk mitigation and incident response.
 Demonstrated experience in data analysis and preparation of reports and/or commentary on findings.

 Additional Information
  Join our positive and vibrant team and be rewarded with these team benefits:

 Flexible work from home arrangements (Home and office)
 50% discounts on accommodation across all Minor Hotel brands in AUS and NZ.
 Discount when you visit any of our restaurants, cafes, bars and wellness retreats.
 50% off The Coffee Club VIP membership
 Furniture, Australia Zoo, Medibank insurance discounts.
 Additional paid leave including Birthday, Vaccine and Study leave
 Career progression & education assistance
 Wellbeing programs (Uprise)
 Reward & Recognition programs

Company Description
  We are SGS – the world’s leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. Our 96,000 employees operate a network of 2,700 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.



 Job Description
 

 Be able to effectively plan, conduct and lead audits across a wide range of industry sector codes.
 Lead assessment / audit teams, as required, ensuring that team members are adequately briefed so that audit / assessment outcomes are achieved and quality of service is maintained and that effective working relationships are sustained both with Clients and within the team.
 Collate audit / assessment findings, prepare reports and communicate findings to clients to ensure understanding of the requirements and area(s) that need to be addressed and/or corrective action required.
 Provide accurate and prompt information to the Delivery Support Team, working closely with them to ensure that client records are up to date and complete and that all other internal information requirements are met.
 Plan and schedule your audit / assessment workload to make best utilisation of your own time and maximise revenue-earning activity, performing the duties described above, to ensure that such duties are performed in an efficient and commercially expedient way
 Maintain and continue to develop audit assessment skills, technical knowledge and participate in ensuring that any Continued Professional Development (CPD) requirements are met.




 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent University level education and experience.
 IRCA Lead Auditor ISO/IEC 27001
 Have knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements applicable to the products or services being audited
 More than 4 years full time experience in an IT related role
 At least 2 years in a role or function relating to information security
 Current, valid driver’s license
 Holding one of following Information Security or Auditor qualifications:


 CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)
 CISM (Certified Information Security Manager)
 CISA (Certified Information System Auditor)
 Other relevant professional qualification directly related with information security

Network Security Engineer


Network Security Engineer – Melbourne, Sydney, or Brisbane 
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity.
 We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences, and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
 Game to join us?
 What you’ll do -
 Your role will be jointly responsible for the development of the Tabcorp network security environments, accountable for delivering Infrastructure and operational services that underpin the entire Tabcorp business. You will assist to mitigate risk and respond to threats to limit the potential of a cyberattack that could impact Tabcorp and to make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world.
 Key accountabilities – 

Provide critical underlying infrastructure services for cloud hosted environments and legacy on premise systems and network, voice, and workplace technologies to Tabcorp teams.
Ensure provisioning of on-going monitoring and management of capacity, associated alerts, availability of services for infrastructure and applications based on agreed service levels to support the service integrity and overall resilience of the Technology organisation.
Evaluating technical security solutions and plan execution of proposed changes providing recommendations to improve the solution.
Analyse, decompose, model, and create requirements for systems, products or sub-systems of moderate to high complexity.
Contribute to architecturally significant requirements and technical risk area identification.
Collaborate to devise solutions aligned to the Strategy and Enterprise Architecture team and work with Enterprise Architects in Domain specific areas.



 What you’ll bring - 

Experience in large-scale complex, diverse and distributed IT operations environment with experience in a network security engineer role in a 24x7 complex business.
Extensive experience in Layer 2 and Layer 3 technologies and related protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, FTP, HTTP/S.
Solid understanding of identify and access principles and solutions (i.e. multi-factor authentication, single sign-on, identity management or related technologies.
Expert in cybersecurity and solid experience in translating information security requirements into Cybersecurity controls and measures Experience with security practices in supporting leading IaaS Cloud technologies.
Knowledge of security protocols, authentication, and authorisation.
Experience in maintaining and supporting mission critical 24*7/365 services.
Experience working with Microsoft Azure/ AWS environment.
Demonstrated experience in successful delivery of projects.
Experience working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers.
Solid understanding of the cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.
An extensive understanding of the Information and Technology industry, as well as digital and technology trends and next best practice.

WHO WE ARE
 Optiver is a tech-driven trading firm and leading global market maker. For over 35 years, Optiver has been improving financial markets around the world, making them more transparent and efficient for all participants. With more than 1,400 employees in offices around the world, we're united in our commitment to improve the market through competitive pricing, execution and thorough risk management. By providing liquidity on multiple exchanges across the world, we actively trade on 70+ exchanges, where we're trusted to always provide accurate buy and sell pricing – no matter the market conditions.


 WHAT YOU'LL DO
 Operating in 50+ exchanges around the world, we are building our Security team to take control of our cybersecurity and help our business stay ahead of emerging threats across our offices. As a Security Engineer, you will join our global security team in our fast-paced Sydney office to help protect our data, infrastructure, and operations. You will get the chance to take ownership of our cybersecurity controls to ensure our defence always remains up to the task.
 You will have the opportunity to combine your knowledge of IT infrastructure, project management and a problem-solving mindset to solve business issues and independently work on improvement opportunities. This is a highly collaborative position, you will be involved in a variety of tasks such as security operations and engineering, risk analysis and security governance. Other responsibilities include:

Develop and use monitoring tools to protect our systems, as well as perform security incident response and remediation when an issue is found.
Take ownership of operational issues, as well as project-based work, where you will act as a lead engineer to deliver from conception through to completion.
Work on security-related user requests and serve as point of escalation for the user support team.
Be part of a flexible rotating on-call roster to support our global operation.



 WHO YOU ARE
 Optiver needs our next Security Engineer to be someone with:

Solid experience working in a Security Engineering or Incident Response related role.
An interest in cybersecurity events and research, with a strong engineering instinct and a deep understanding of both technical and business problems.
Automation scripting experience in Python or PowerShell, and good knowledge of Linux systems.
Exposure to endpoint security controls such as AV, EDR, Vulnerability Scanning and Patch Management.
Knowledge in common OS attack vectors, system hardening, and secure privilege escalation.
Experience delivering projects end to end individually and in a team environment, from initiation to implementation.



 WHAT YOU'LL GET

The chance to work alongside diverse and intelligent peers in a rewarding environment.
Competitive remuneration, including an attractive bonus structure and additional leave entitlements.
Training, mentorship and personal development opportunities.
Gym membership plus weekly in-house chair massages.
Daily breakfast, lunch and an in-house barista.
Regular social events including an annual company trip.
A work-from-home allowance and support.
Guided relocation, a competitive relocation package and visa sponsorship where necessary.


 As an intentionally flat organisation, we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included, valued, and respected, because we believe our best work is done together.
 Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

About Us 

 Marketplacer is a global Software as a Service (SaaS) company headquartered in Melbourne, Australia. Our leading marketplace solution takes business beyond physical stores and inventory holdings - making it easy to sell what you don’t own. Marketplacer is responsible for the business transformations of Albertsons, Nokia, Myer & Woolworths to name a few. 

 We want to build a company where people feel empowered to do their best work, wherever they are. Our team is spread across Australia, New Zealand and the US - with additional global locations due to open soon as well. We empower our people to work flexibly in remote settings but we love to socialise and get together in person on a regular basis as well. 

 About the role 

 In this role, you will work closely with various internal and external partners to advise on the development, improvement, and management of the ISO27001:2013 and SOC2 Information Security Management System (ISMS) framework. 


Key Responsibilities Include:
 Review and maintain cyber security policies and standards 
Coordinate and support independent audit of cyber security controls as part of internal and external audits 
Maintain and track effectively the ISO27001 & SOC2 certification tasks with stakeholders 
Audit systems and processes to align to our certification requirements 
Administer the completion of risk treatment plans and compliance initiatives 
Communicate risk assessment findings to both technical and non-technical audiences 
Investigation of security breach or incident 
Ensuring our ISO27001:2013 & SOC2 audit tasks are completed with the Information Security Manager every year. 
Collaborate with internal product teams to advise on security threats with new and changed features. 
The ability to identify security gaps in the environment and the ability to speak up and suggest how we can make things better. 


About you:
 Proven experience in risk assessment and internal audit 
Commercial experience with Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) 
Industry relevant certifications including CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC & ISO 27001 Lead Implementer/Auditor 
Excellent communication and stakeholder experience 
Ability to communicate with technical and non technical audiences 

 We’re excited about you if you also have 

 Know the ISO27001:2013 standard and understand how to tighten security controls to stay compliant. 
Are willing to work as a team in a fast-paced environment 
Have prior auditing or analytical experience in cyber security. 

 What are the benefits? 

 A culture of smart, fun and values driven people, where everybody’s voice matters 
Flexibility and freedom to make a big impact on Marketplacer in your role 
Access to our learning platform with over 90,000 courses & videos to choose from 
A culture of integrity focused on a mission 
An environment where curiosity and collaboration is cherished 
Constant celebration of winning 
2 extra days of leave per year to dedicate towards volunteering or for your wellbeing 
Regular team building events, strategy days and company wide events - both in person and online 

 Even if you feel you may not meet 100% of the criteria, please apply. You may exceed your own expectations, or we may have another opportunity that suits your potential. Our recruitment process is not perfect, but we will try our best to help you feel heard and supported throughout the experience.

The role:
 You will be responsible for coordinating and completing the delivery of core project activities for a range of projects with competing priorities. Tasks include managing issues and risks, procuring and managing ICT assets, monitoring resource and budget costs against agreed criteria, and drafting project products. 

 You will also maintain relationships with and between internal and external stakeholders, facilitate effective communications and foster relationships through feedback mechanisms and management of expectations. 

 Are you right for this role? 
To be successful in this role you will have demonstrated analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills and an ability to coordinate multiple tasks within agreed priorities, timeframes and accountabilities. Experience in an IM/ICT project environment, including scheduling, risk management, reporting and budgeting, and an ability to coordinate the delivery of work packages. 

 You will have knowledge of appropriate project management methodologies and ability to provide advice on the use of appropriate project management techniques, methodologies and tools, with Experience in, or the ability to assist with the compilation of program/project information, maintenance of program/project files and the preparation and presentation of management reports. 

 The preferred candidate will have knowledge of appropriate project management techniques, methodologies and tools (preferably PRINCE2). 

 About eHealth Queensland 
eHealth Queensland is one of the largest Information Communication Technology operations in the state. It is responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of information systems and technologies so that Queensland Health employees and health providers have access to information that supports the delivery of health care. 


Benefits of working with eHealth Queensland:
 By joining eHealth Queensland, you will work within a fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment where every employee plays a critical role in our ongoing success. 


You will enjoy a variety of benefits, including:


Competitive salary + generous superannuation and leave loading
Flexible working arrangements
Diverse work culture
Career training and development
 To apply for this exciting opportunity, submit your resume and a one-page cover letter online today.This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia License.

Join a forward-looking Cyber protection team working across Macquarie Technology to create future ready services that protect Macquarie’s data from internal and external threats.
 As a member of the protection team, you will be responsible for security applications and systems within a global operating environment. You will design, build and operate solutions focused on data loss protection to meet business, service, and lifecycle requirements.
 Your responsibilities include

identify and perform proactive platform systems management
own and resolve production issues escalated from L2 support, mentoring others and creating knowledge base articles where possible
ongoing upgrade and maintenance of associated application platforms
maintain relationships with key internal stakeholders
work with product vendor to troubleshoot complex issues and identify new capabilities to meet changing business requirements
work with diverse stakeholders across multiple Macquarie businesses to perform analysis activities for the design, definition and implementation of information protection measures across Macquarie
facilitate training of key service offerings to the business
identify and implement automated solutions to remove existing manual tasks

To be successful, you will bring 

ideally 2 or more years’ experience in an infrastructure or security infrastructure/application base understanding and experience in Mac / Windows operating systems
experience working with security products such as McAfee/Trellix, Forcepoint and Netskope is desirable.
ability to work with global technology teams
ability to deal effectively with colleagues and business users working in a constantly evolving environment across multiple time-zones and cultures
a customer-focused approach with a "service first" mentality and best-in-class communication skills
a self-starter mentality and assume responsibility for a range of activities and tasks and willing to learn.
ability to view current processes and procedures as opportunities for enhancement, tuning and improvement
a risk-focused approach with an ability to perform due diligence and make informed decisions
a keen interest in cloud-based technologies
experience with data analytics and event management tools including Power BI and Splunk
exposure to ITIL

To join a high performing Cyber team, apply online now or for more information visit www.macquarie.com/careers
 About the Corporate Operations Group
 The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Market Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. The Corporate Operations Group’s purpose is to power the entrepreneurial enterprise.
 Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
 The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
 We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.









About Macquarie

A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 18,000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.







Job no: COG-959875
      
Work type: Permanent - Full time
      
Location: Brisbane, Melbourne, Sydney

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges
 At Honeywell, we make a lot of incredible things. But most importantly, we make the future, and are looking for people to join our team global team of future shapers. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our performance culture comprised of diverse leaders, thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who are changing the future. Our people are committed to each other and to the realisation of our vision through their unique job functions. Our businesses embrace the challenges of innovation so that we define the future. And our global opportunities are endless for you to grow and get recognised for your passion to perform.
We are seeking an experienced Cybersecurity Specialist to join our APAC ICT and Cybersecurity operations team. Reporting into the APAC ICT and Cybersecurity Operations Leader you will be responsible for enabling our teams to sell, install and service Cyber Security offerings securely, at speed and consistently across customer base.
In this dynamic role – your key responsibilities will involve working in collaboration with local leadership, sales and delivery teams to drive improvement and compliance of solutions with Honeywell and industry standards and best practices. 
This role will form part of a growing global ICT and Cybersecurity Operations team responsible for designing, delivering, and maintaining complex and critical ICT infrastructure and systems as part of larger technology solutions. This includes remote services, large servers/storage/virtualisation deployments, wired and wireless networks, and cyber security assessments/validation.
This role will suit a highly motivated person who enjoys working to the highest standards, in a fast-paced technical environment with a variety of technology.
Key Responsibilities:

 Assume support and/or lead role in assigned projects/service contracts ensuring cybersecurity/networks scope is delivered on time and within budget and to the satisfaction of the customer.


 Implement security controls and processes to protect deployed solutions


 Conduct security assessment to ensure compliance against Honeywell and industry standards.


 Set the IT security framework and maintenance practices our services teams should be working to, to ensure our customer deployed systems are kept secure.


 Keep technically current with networking and certified wireless product/systems portfolio, while maintaining expert knowledge on specific designated network disciplines.


 Support in the identification of new IT security partners, qualification and testing of equipment to form part of wider solutions.


 Maintain cyber security certifications and keep technically current with the security requirements, while maintaining expert knowledge on specific designated disciplines


 Develop sound and trusted relationships with internal and external customers by providing accurate and efficient technical/engineering support.


 Protect the integrity of the Honeywell implemented software, server and network infrastructure and services by managing access, monitoring global ICT security news and technological developments, and acting on these using vendor advice and current technical knowledge.


 Key Experience, Qualifications and Capabilities:

 Bachelor in Information Technology / Systems or Computer Science


 Relevant Cyber Security certifications and/or training including CISSP, CEH etc


 Certification and/or Training in relevant ICT industry technologies such as MCSA/MCSE (Microsoft), CCNA/CCNP/CCDP/CCIE (Cisco), VCP (VMware), CA (Citrix) or similar is desirable


 5-10 years experience in Cyber Security / Network Engineering or equivalent capacity.


 Experience in performing security audits/assessments, design/implementation/hardening networks.


 Knowledge of appropriate security industry regulations and standards such as ISA-99/ISA-62443 , NERC CIP, NIST and ISO/IEC 27001.


 Experience with security scanners: nmap, Nessus and other open source tools.


 Possess sound knowledge of Cisco Networking Switches & Firewall Devices.


 Excellent troubleshooting skills to resolve complex network and or application or system integration issues.


 Experience in pre-sales consultancy, translating requirements into Cybersecurity solutions (desirable).

About Us
The world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.
Discover More
We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/
If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.
The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.
Honeywell is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we support a diverse workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.
Finalist 2019 AHRI awards – Best workplace diversity and inclusion program.
Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, colour, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.  For more information on how we process your information in the job application process, please refer to Recruitment Privacy Notice. If a disability prevents you from applying for a job through our website, request assistance here. No other requests will be acknowledged.

location: Hybrid remote in Melbourne VIC+2 locations
job_summary:
About us
 Saab Australia is a defence, security and cyber solutions provider, specialising in the development and integration of major defence and security systems. For over 30 years in Australia, we have built a reputation for delivering complex systems integration projects that provide proven and advanced capabilities to keep us ahead of today’s challenges.
 From combat, communications, security and underwater systems, to mixed reality, cyber security and deployable health solutions, our extensive portfolio of products and services provide high-technology solutions for defence forces and civil industries across the globe.
 Apply today to join our crew and deliver solutions with purpose.
 The role
 As part of our Civil Solutions group, Saab is seeking multiple Security Systems Engineers to play a key role in furthering the development of Saab’s OneView physical security information management system and broader security system solutions. The role will contribute to the group systems engineering team in the tender, execution and delivery phases of civil security projects.
 Further, the successful candidate will:

 Design, build, test and validate security solutions in a desktop and lab environment.
 Analyse trade drawings (i.e. architectural, electrical, mechanical and civil) in order to identify potential design and installation problems.
 Perform various engineering and implementation tasks such as Site Surveys; prototype testing, initial mock up
 Generate various calculations; including but not limited to power, heat, voltage drop, conduit sizing and bandwidth
 Develop and validate drawing packages to ensure conformity to requirements
 Research optimal equipment/systems to be included in proposals.
 Identify and resolve field device and system application and interoperability issues

 Flexible work arrangements such as hybrid work from home / office, 9 day fortnight and part time (0.8 FTE minimum) will be considered for this role.
 We are open to this role being based from either our Adelaide or Melbourne offices. 
About you
 Your skills and experience will include:

 Security Industry Experience preferably in Engineering.
 Experience with security related sub-systems such as CCTV, duress systems, perimeter detection systems, biometrics, key safes and intercoms.
 Possess a comprehensive understanding of high end security applications
 Experience with security system hardware build, modification and troubleshooting.For example access control systems.
 Understand complex technical issues and managing them within a fast-paced business environment with deadlines
 Ability to write clear and precise technical reports.
 Ability to undertake high level requirements derivation, system design and implementation

 Culture and benefits
 We employ over 600 Australians and are committed to fostering a culture of excellence and enriching the employee experience.
 By joining Saab, you’ll be a part of a collaborative and supportive organisation, where your professional growth and work-life balance are emphasised. You’ll work within an innovative and vibrant workplace, while having the opportunity to develop a long-term, fulfilling career.
 For further information about at career at Saab, visit the page adjacent: https://www.saab.com/markets/australia/careers/saab-life
 Applications
 Click ‘Apply’ to submit your CV and cover letter in support of your application. You may contact our careers team at careers.mailbox@au.saabgroup.com for a copy of the full position description.
 Saab Australia is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply. We also welcome applications from individuals with culturally diverse backgrounds. 
Saab Australia is a proud supporter of the Veterans’ Employment Program and welcomes the interest of ex-service members, veterans and their families.

job_title: Threat Detection and Incident Response - Cyber Security
job_summary:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 What you’ll be doing:

 Our Consultants are part of a team of high performing professionals who are passionate about solving complex problems and delivering innovative solutions. Imagine working alongside businesses who are using artificial intelligence (AI) to detect cancer earlier in patients. Imagine defining digital and technology strategies that revolutionise the transport of tomorrow. Imagine working with advanced analytics to help miners increase their productivity. Imagine helping clients to prevent cyber-attacks by implementing blockchain technology.

 It’s meaningful work, every single day. You will make complex technologies accessible to clients across every industry, helping them to find inventive solutions to their business problems. You will help them grow, while discovering limitless opportunities to develop yourself.

 As well as developing your technical skills, you will learn about business strategy and business issues. You will collaborate with different departments and functions, with the freedom and ability to explore new ideas and devise your own solutions. You won’t just be implementing new technologies, you will be designing the way they are used. You will be transforming businesses, one idea at a time.

 On your first day, we'd love for you to have:


 Experience within several large-scale technology transformation projects, taking ownership of delivery across client team.
 Ability to seek alignment of business and technology, operating across organisational and technology silos to drive common approaches, and in delivering sustainable agile and re-usable solutions.
 Knowledge of a range of Project Management approaches including PRINCEII, PMP,Agile, etc.


 It's great, but not required, if you have:


 Strong consulting experience and background.
 Experience delivering projects in a Cloud environment.


 What we offer


 Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.


 Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
 Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


 At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.

 We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).

 We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.

 The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

 The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider

 EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 The opportunity

 Our Cybersecurity team at EY is seeking people who want to be part of something bigger. We are recruiting self-starters, people passionate about making a difference and those keen to inspire others at a firm that is ranked the #1 professional services employer in Universe's ‘most attractive employer’ for the third consecutive year. The cyber field, and your place in it at EY, offers a breadth of responsibilities, opportunities and challenges to help you reach your potential.

 Our EY Cyber team works with leading organisations in the public and private sector to translate uncertainty into confidence. You will help clients improve their cybersecurity in a wide variety of ways, from assessing cyber capability and advising on strategy and technology, to designing and building transformation program's and specific security solutions, to implementing and also managing security solutions, often alongside selected market leading vendors.
 
Your opportunity is to:


 Support the delivery and maintenance of cybersecurity services, for large or more complex projects, using advanced technical capabilities
 Take accountability for the development, delivery and maintenance of cybersecurity solutions, tools and processes, driving compliance with, and contributing to, the development of relevant standards
 Work with various departments across client organisations to fully understand business and needs and ensure cyber solutions meet the requirements from a security, business and technical perspective


 Skills and attributes for success:

 At EY, our cyber team hires for quality candidates first, and we pride ourselves in hiring and developing a diverse group of talented individuals. As such, non-traditional backgrounds are always welcome.

 To qualify for the role, we would normally expect you to have:


 A tertiary qualification (university or other)
 2 or more years of working experience
 Working experience in cybersecurity and/or consulting
 Strong communication skills and stakeholder management skills which will support you to effectively work with a diverse group of individuals
 An analytical mindset, and a commitment to quality outcomes
 An ability to flourish in a results-oriented environment
 Proficiency in MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint


 Ideally, you will also have:


 Possession of a relevant cyber certification(s)
 Knowledge of and experience with relevant industry security standards
 Involvement in industry related organisations
 A history of high performance teaming or collaboration


 What we offer


 Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.


 Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
 Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


 At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.

 We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4). Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $72,000 including 10% superannuation.

 We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.

 The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

 EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering

An opportunity to make an ongoing contributing to teaching and research in Computer Science
Full-time tenurable appointment
Base salary range: Level B $105,043 – $124,301 p.a. (pro rata) plus 17% superannuation

The University of Western Australia (UWA) is ranked among the top 100 universities in the world and a member of the prestigious Australian Group of Eight research intensive universities. With a strong research track record, vibrant campus and working environments, supported by the freedom to innovate and inspire, there is no better time to join Western Australia’s top university.
 About the team
 The Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering in the School of Physics, Mathematics and Computing is renowned for its award-winning researchers, teachers and facilities. The Department offers broad-based undergraduate and postgraduate programs in Computer Science, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Artificial Intelligence and Software Engineering. The Department’s research strengths include computer vision, natural language processing, AI, machine learning and optimisation, computer systems, cybersecurity, computational logic and bioinformatics. In the resource-rich state of Western Australia opportunities for partnership and collaborative research are extensive and the Department has well established links with WA industries.
 Further information about the School and its teaching programmes can be found at
 https://www.uwa.edu.au/ems/Schools/Physics-Mathematics-and-Computing/Department-of-Computer-Science-and-Software-Engineering
 About the opportunity
 We are seeking an experienced Lecturer to join our Department and make a long-term contribution to research and teaching excellence.
 You will lecture in a range of undergraduate and postgraduate units in Computer Science and Cybersecurity while contributing to ongoing development of the Department’s academic programs. You will also build a research portfolio of high-quality publications, grants, and collaborations, and assist with the supervision of PhD, masters, and honours research students.
 To be considered for this role, you will demonstrate:

PhD degree in Computer Science
Demonstrated teaching experience relevant to the Department's teaching programs in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, and Software Engineering
Evidence of and willingness to teach large units, engage in curriculum design and organise teaching activities
Demonstrated research performance, a strong publication record and the ability to apply for grants
Good interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team

About your application
 Full details of the position's responsibilities and the selection criteria are outlined in the position description: PD 512526.pdf
 You are required to address the selection criteria in your submission in a separate document. For information to assist you with compiling statements to answer the selection criteria, please visit Addressing the selection criteria
 Closing date: 11:55 PM AWST on Wednesday, 28 September 2022
 To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Rachel Cardell-Oliver on (08) 6488 2231 or at rachel.cardell-oliver@uwa.edu.au.
 This position is open to international applicants.
 Application Details: Please apply online via the Apply Now button.
 Our commitment to inclusion and diversity 
UWA is committed to a diverse workforce and an equitable and inclusive workplace. We celebrate difference and believe diversity is fundamental to achieving our goals as a globally recognised Top 100 educational and research institution. We are committed to creating a safe work environment for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, the LGBTIQA+ community and people living with disability.

We have a globally competitive, gender neutral parental leave policy with 26 weeks paid leave after 12 months service and 36 weeks after 5 years.
We have on-campus childcare facilities for child 6 weeks to kindy.
We facilitate flexible working, with part-time and job-sharing arrangements considered.
We have an ongoing partnership with Pride in Diversity and were recently awarded a Bronze Employer status for LGBTIQA+ inclusion.
We have Athena SWAN Bronze accreditation and actively work to improve gender equity.


Should you have any queries relating to your application, please contact the individual named in the advertisement. Alternatively, contact the Talent team at talent-hr@uwa.edu.au with details of your query. To enable a quick response, please include the 6-digit job reference number and a member of the team will respond to your enquiry.

Be part of an inclusive and high-performing team
Enjoy a rewarding career move with opportunities for development
Make a difference with a fund that puts members first
About us
When you work for Australian Retirement Trust, every day is an opportunity to be a force for good in the lives of more than 2 million members.
Australian Retirement Trust
is the super fund formed through the merger of Sunsuper and QSuper. As
one of Australia’s largest
superannuation funds,
we
proudly take care of over $200 billion in retirement savings.
Our teams are as diverse and unique as the members we strive to inspire and empower. Our inclusive culture means you will be valued and heard in a respectful workplace, where you can be your authentic self every day.
About the role
Every one of our team contributes to helping make our members’ world better. As
a
Security Consulting Manager
in our Information Security team, you will provide broad information security consulting services to both technical and business areas within Australian Retirement Trust (ART). You will also be responsible for providing subject matter expertise and guidance to internal teams to ensure security is continually built into new initiatives, with threats and vulnerabilities controlled or mitigated.
In this permanent role, you will provide security architectural and design advice to technical teams as well as management and will assess the security posture of solutions or services. You will have the opportunity to promote security solution design practices, ensuring that technical solutions meet ART policy and standard requirements.
This is a key role within the business, and the ideal candidate will be confident in providing authoritative advice and guidance on the requirements for security controls in collaboration with experts in other functions such as Legal, IT & Risk. If this sounds like you, and you’re looking to utilise your Information Security skills in a dynamic new role, then don’t delay - apply today!
About you
If this is the right role for you, your skills and qualifications may include:
Demonstrated expert knowledge and deep understanding of IT and information security management
Relevant tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Information Systems or another related field
Relevant industry recognised qualifications in Information Security such as CISSP, CISM or equivalent
Ability to identify and analyse trends within the IT security and financial services industry and apply best practice solutions
Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of contemporary frameworks and/or methodologies:
DevSecOps, AGILE, ITIL, COBIT, TOGAF, SABSA
ISO 27001, NIST800-53 and NIST Cyber Security Framework
Ability to work in a cross-functional team environment
Broad knowledge of current Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) technological tools and methodologies.
How you’ll benefit
As part of the Australian Retirement Trust team, you’ll have access to development programs that help you focus on solutions-based outcomes, and innovative ways to support our members. We provide a dynamic and rewarding work environment featuring:
Competitive salary, bonus, and super offerings
Flexible work arrangements
Generous parental leave entitlements
A focus on learning and development, including study assistance
Volunteer and community service leave
LGBTQI + and disability employee networks
Wellbeing initiatives including Employee Assistance Program and discounted health insurance
An additional leave day each year on top of annual leave.
Next steps
Make a difference and join a high-performing team where you will be encouraged to be your best. If this sounds like the role for you, apply before
Tuesday, 13 September 2022.

job_title: Lead Identity Architect, Cyber Security IDAM
job_summary:
About the Role
 This key role for BOQ will help drive the IDAM security strategy for the group during an important phase of our digital transformation. You're main focus will be leading Identity Architecture for the group, designing and the implementation of security strategies and road maps to help support the Cyber Security program for BOQ.
 The following are some key accountabilities for the role:

Building IDAM aspects into the BOQ Group’s collective technology architecture (including enterprise, infrastructure and data).
Architectural governance of Sailpoint, Okta, CyberArk, ISAM as a part of the staff IDAM ecosystem.
Ensure that solution overview and high level designs meet BOQ Cyber Security IDAM Standards.
Provide Identity guidance to IT and business on initiatives in the ideation phase.
Contribute to solution overview and high level design documents for socialisation with BOQ Architectural Community.
Perform consulting BOQ activities to initiatives e.g. onboarding to IDAM platforms.
Present and evaluate high level identity architecture & artefacts at a technology governance forum to ensure architectural and strategic fit.
Participate in/run design authority sessions, in collaboration with other solution architects, evaluating proposed designs against established standards and architecture framework and principles.


 About you


.5+ years of experience in Identity and Access Management.
Knowledge of known industry frameworks and regulations such as NIST, ISO, Privacy, PCI-DSS, APRA etc
Knowledge of Australian Financial Services regulation, from a security perspective, especially CPS.
Extensive hands on experience in Identity Management, Access Management, Privileged Access, Governance, SSO, Federation, Directory Services, Enterprise Architecture, Networks.
Working knowledge of with Sailpoint, OKTA, CyberArk and Active Directory, or similar.
