Current Victorian Security Registration
Good time management with projects and work/life balance
Strong ability to interpret client expectations and define them technically
Ability to run projects with minimal supervision
Good at recording and keeping track of all communication and decisions made
Good at setting, managing and hitting goals and deadlines
Good with numbers for cost estimates as well as financial management of projects
Excellent at multitasking and responding to emails, messages and calls in a timely manner
Engineering degree is ideal but not critical
Prior Consulting experience is preferred (minimum 3 years)
With over 3 years’ experience in the Security industry with strong technical Electronic Security skills
Highly motivated person looking for opportunities to lead projects as well as working within a team environment
Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills as it will largely be a client facing role;
Excellent report writing and analytical skills (very strong in written English);
Competent in use of Windows based computing applications;
Willingness to travel for projects with possible short-term interstate travel required
Driver’s license as you may be required to travel to site as part of your role.


Training and Development 

NDY has a strong focus on the development of our staff and training will be a key element of this development whether on internal or external training courses. We will develop a career plan for each staff member that will focus on core elements of your role to provide you with a clear progression in your career path.
 Additionally, the successful candidate will be involved in a wide range of projects from Healthcare facilities through to commercial office developments and retail developments, both as new build and refurbishments.
 Training and development in these roles will be provided to the right candidate. Interstate travel may be required and overseas assignments are possible in the longer term.

Additional Information 


You will only be contacted if you are shortlisted for an interview, this process can take up to four weeks from the closing date.
This position is available only to permanent Australian residents or applicants who hold the relevant Visa with authority to work in Australia. Please ensure this information is clearly stated on your application 
Find out more about working for NDY at www.ndy.com/careers


Application

job_title: Cyber Security Engineer – Major Transport - Australia
job_summary:
Due to our ever-growing portfolio of national projects within our Transport - Rail, Roads and Utilities - HV Transmission businesses we are opening up opportunities for experienced and highly skilled Project Managers, Construction Managers, Commercial Managers, Quantity Surveyors and disciplined Engineers to the international market.
  

Why Australia?
 Take 3 minutes to watch the following video and see how you can shape your dreams
  

   There's Nothing Like Australia - (3 minute version) - Bing video
  

Health Care
 The Medicare system in Australia provides access to a wide range of health care services, free medical care in public hospitals and lower costs for prescription medicines. Certain categories of visitors, all Australian citizens and all eligible Australian residents can access these services after enrolling in Medicare.
  

Education
 The Australian public education system has a good reputation for its high quality of students and learning methodologies – it must be noted that academic results are not the only factor that the Australian education system teaches, with equal emphasis on how students interact, learn, do in sports etc. It is a more holistic based system.
  

Weather and Climate
 Australia is also an attractive migration destination because of its temperate weather on most of the East coast. All four season can be found on the Australian east coast region, with the full experience of living through the blue skies of summer and spring as well as the coolness and crispness of winter and autumn.
  

World's most liveable cities
 The Economist runs a survey every year in order to rank the most liveable cities in the world. According to these surveys, multiple Australian cities made it every year on the list of the best cities to live in the world.
  

The Coffee Culture
 Do you love your coffee? If you do, then Australia can be considered a coffee nirvana. Australia is known for its coffee culture – everyone drinks coffee here. There are coffee shops all over the major cities, grinding fresh beans for your coffee fix. Migrants moving from countries with a similar coffee culture have one more reason to like Australia.
  



The Food
 The food is great in Australia, with multiple Michelin star restaurants, fast food chains, cafes and restaurants of every kind. Because of the large migrant population across the country you can enjoy very diverse food options, from authentic Vietnamese to Italian and Chinese food, all being made with freshest ingredients farmed predominantly in Australia.
  



Pathway to citizenship
 All permanent residents can eventually qualify to become an Australian citizen. A big advantage for migrants moving to the country is the fact that Australia recognises dual citizenship and that children born to permanent residents in Australia can apply for citizenship even if their parents don’t yet qualify.
  



OVERVIEW OF UGL
 UGL is well-known and respected for providing end-to-end engineering, construction and maintenance services within, rail and transport, communications and technology systems, oil and gas, power, renewables and resources, water and defence markets. UGL partners with some of the world’s largest blue-chip companies and government agencies, private enterprises and public institutions.
  

Currently $10.5billion work in hand to deliver
Major Infrastructure projects across Transport – Rail, Road, New Energy & Utilities – HV Transmission
Locations across all the major states, Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide


What we offer
 When you join UGL you will to join an 8,000 plus strong organisation owned by the CIMIC Group, one of the world's leading international contractors where you will gain exposure to a diverse range of opportunities, which include:
  

The opportunity to work with a team that focuses on personal development & further training
Exposure to a diverse range of projects
Competitive group remuneration and benefits including health and wellbeing program with company-funded salary continuance insurance
Flexible work arrangements and a culture that values diversity and innovation, evolving with market changes and new technologies


   Our team works hard and celebrates successes and efforts through our monthly reward and recognition scheme. If you are looking for a bright future and opportunity to grow your career, then join UGL – a great place to work!
  

   For further information please take a look at the UGL Website; Opportunities in Australia with UGL | UGL careers (ugllimited.com)
  

ABOUT THE POSITION ON OFFER


Cyber Security Engineer – Major Transport – Australia


   As a Cyber Security Engineer within our Transport & Technology business, you would offer solutions to our clients working within large scale infrastructure projects and intelligent transport technologies.
  

   Working with a strong leadership team, you will be growing your knowledge to develop and provide technical advice and finding solutions for medium and large infrastructure projects.
  

   This position will provide support in applied cybersecurity for industrial control systems. This includes implementation of different cybersecurity standards/guidelines (e.g., the Framework for Improving Critical Infrastructure Cybersecurity, Manufacturing Profile of the CSF, NIST Special Publication 800-82, ISA/IEC 62443, etc.)
  

Implement cybersecurity technologies that meet the ICS cybersecurity standards/guidelines to address different risk scenarios.
Identify individual cybersecurity mechanisms/technologies to meet cybersecurity requirements specified in the Cybersecurity Framework.
Work with ICS engineers to measure impact on performance to determine acceptable performance requirement and testing parameters which include: network and operational performance impacts.


About you:


Tertiary degree qualification to Bachelor status in Electrical Engineering, mechatronics or a related discipline with experience working industrial control systems
General or specific Cyber Security certifications e.g CCNA, CISSP, GSEC, GRID, GICSP, OSCP, CEH, CISM etc
Superior written and verbal communication skills, and computer proficiency with programs such as Word, Excel and Outlook.
Good Understanding with hands-on experience in Cyber Security technologies such as Log Management tools (SIEM), Network Security tools such as Firewalls (Cisco ASA and Fortigate preferred), IDS/ IPS, DLP and Endpoint Protection products.


   Please note that relevant screening checks will be conducted as part of the recruitment process. These may include a national criminal history check and for you to undergo pre-employment medical assessment including drug and alcohol screen.
  

How to apply
 If you want to be part of an organisation that appreciates the diversity and richness of its people and seeks to create inclusive environments that promote your talent and skills, please click the apply button and send in a copy of your resume and cover letter.
  

Visa & Relocation
 UGL will support the Visa & Relocation process for successful international candidates. A member of the Talent Community will discuss this further with you during the initial conversation.
  


 Discipline: Engineering
 Primary Location: Australia
 Work Type: Full-time

Position Summary 

Our Network Security Engineer will interface with our valued clients on projects to develop secure network solutions. The Network and Security Engineer shall participate in Assessments, Audits, Design, and deployment projects in Network, Security and Virtualization.

 These Projects will be specific to enabling a connected enterprise / IT-OT convergence / Industry 4.0 by connecting the Industrial Internet of Things.

 Potential candidates should have:

 ‘Hands-on’ experience in Networking / Cybersecurity for a variety of automated manufacturing processes and equipment or process control.
 Experience in design and deploying security controls for an Industrial Network. These can include system management hardening, device hardening, end point security, perimeter security, disaster recovery, threat detection and monitoring as examples.
 Understanding of NIST 800-82, NERC-CIP, IEC-62443 Standards
 Solid technical skills with EtherNet/IP or other Ethernet based networks, specifically around assessment, design and implementation of complex systems.
 Strong commercial skills, ability to handle multiple projects, communication skills, ability to diagnose automation problems and interact with teams, clients and vendors.
 Familiarity with a variety of security and/or networking concepts, practices, and procedures, to include manufacturing and enterprise network convergence, network protocols, communication optimization, application effects on system performance and human exploitation techniques on the manufacturing network.
 Experience in developing and deploying solutions in a virtual environment.
 Experience in Network Architecture, PLC, Networking and SCADA design/programming including data extraction and data analysis.
 Exposure to PLC programming packages (Rockwell Automation or comparable platforms) is desirable.
 Design, implement and support customer’s converged business and manufacturing/industrial systems and user needs in parallel with their overall business strategies.
 Write detailed documentation that could include user needs, system specifications, observed issues with remediation recommendations or implementation requirements in order to develop or modify manufacturing infrastructure.
 Design, recommend, and implement system security changes.
 Design customer secure manufacturing architecture and provides vision, problem anticipation, and problem solving ability to customers.


 Minimum Qualifications / skill sets:


 Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or Information Technology or related technology driven degree with minimum 5 years of work experience. If no degree, 5+ years of experience in Manufacturing Control Systems, Network Engineering, and Industrial Security Controls.
 Cisco CCNA Certification. Hands-on experience configuring IT/OT equipment (Cisco ASA, Cisco Switches, Virtual Server Environments, Anti-Virus Software). Previous experience working as part of a large, multi-disciplinary team completing full project life-cycle implementations.
 Candidates with Cisco / VMWare / Cybersecurity related certifications will be preferred (CCNP, GICSP, CISSP, VCP)
 Travel Requirements - Flexibility for travel 25% - 75% is required and can include both domestic and international trips.
 Legal authorization to work in the Australia is required.

job_title: Senior Consultant, Manager & Associate Director – Cyber Secu...
job_summary:
Job no: 515120
  
Work type: Permanent Full Time
  
Location: Canberra, Sydney, Adelaide
  
Division: Management Consulting
  


KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges, empower change, drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities.
 KPMG's Management Consulting division is looking for individuals who are passionate about Architecture, Engineering, or security assurance and iRAP to join their growing Cyber Security team in Canberra at the Senior Consultant, Manager, and Associate Director level on a permanent basis. These opportunities will require you to play an active role in growing KPMG's Cyber Security service line.
 You will work closely with clients to evaluate their business strategy, understand their technology environment and provide recommendations to enable them to improve their ability to respond to Cyber risks and threats.
 Your Opportunity
 This role will focus on Architecture, Engineering, Security assurance or Business Analysis, and you will have a minimum clearance of NV1 with the ability to get PV. You will work with teams from across KPMG’s Management Consulting division to ensure we are able to communicate and deliver on the KPMG customer promise. You ideally be part of one or four capability chapters: Security Assurance, Security Architecture and Engineering, Security Program Management, or Cyber Software Engineering. Your day-to-day activities will include:

Developing your consulting skills in a range of technology services such as IT Architecture, Engineering and IT security, security strategy, secure systems acquisition and process management (PMOs), security governance or security sourcing.
Assisting clients in managing cyber risks in a way that enhances their ability to meet business objectives, stakeholder expectations and compliance obligations.
Performing gap assessments between the security processes and operations of our clients against recognised global and domestic standards and regulations (e.g. ISM, PSPF, ISO27001, NIST).
Developing benchmarking reports to provide our clients with insight on where they stand when measured against relevant industry practices.
Improving our clients' understanding and management of risk in technology through designing and implementing effective controls over technology assets.
Expanding the security skills at the Senior Consultant and Consultant levels in the existing team through CISM and CISSP, ISO27001 like training.
Leading junior staff to deliver the appropriate outcomes.

You ideally should hold an NV1 clearance or above, although we will consider candidates with lower or nil clearance with exceptional CVs, and the ability to gain clearance.
 How are you Extraordinary?
 At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities.

To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience should include one or more of the following: 
    
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Solid knowledge of Government security principles, the ISM, DSPF, PSPF, ISO27001 and NIST.
Solid presentation skills including an ability to articulate deeply complex technical issues to senior/executive/board level audience.
Proven relationship building and maintenance skills.
A background in IT consulting, IT audit, Risk Management or Cyber Security
Tertiary qualification (preferably cyber, technology, Security studies, similar) and Post-grad qualifications such as CISM/CISSP. Our more experienced senior staff such as our Directors mostly have Masters Degrees and some have PHd’s.
Experience in sales, client delivery and team leadership with an ability to work across multiple teams, delivery groups and stakeholders.
Demonstrated experience in management consulting or an industry role working across geographies would be preferred.
 

The KPMG Difference
 Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.
 We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.
 Please note: Due to the upcoming Holiday period, all candidates will be contacted early 2022.

We’re Nominet – a world-leading domain name registry. For over 25 years, we’ve been operating at the heart of internet infrastructure. While we're best known for running .UK domains, we also help protect public services from cyber threat.Our aim is to create a world which is more connected, inclusive and secure. We know that technology has the power to transform lives by creating opportunities and providing support where it’s needed most.As a public benefit company, our work funds the ability to make a positive impact on society. We’ve donated millions to projects that use technology to improve peoples’ lives and have committed to delivering £60m worth of support over the next three years.We understand the impact the Internet has on the environment and are committed to helping the UK reach Net Zero by 2050. We’re already a Carbon Neutral company through offsetting our emissions and will continue to work on reducing our footprint.
About the roleWorking in the Customer Success Team in Nominet Cyber Australia, you will provide outstanding customer service and 1st /2nd line technical support to organisations using critical services provided by Nominet to its government customers.This is not your standard service desk support role. Yes, you will need to respond to tickets and resolve technical issues, but there is much more to get involved in - like onboarding new customers, solution-specific queries and change requests. You will have the opportunity to dive deep and get into the detailed aspects of our customers’ technical challenges.
The Nominet Cyber Australia team was set up in December 2020 to deliver the Australian Protective Domain Name Service (AUPDNS) on behalf of the Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC). It is there to protect Australian public sector concerns and is a significant operation, looking after 150+ organisations, equating to well over 550,000 users.
The essential bits

Ensure that service to the customer is always of the highest standard and quality
Provide first and second line customer support to all customers and stakeholders across a range of issues such as technical issues, onboarding of new customers, solution-specific queries and change requests, and other general queries.
Answer customer queries that come through the Nominet shared support line (9am – 5pm Australian Eastern Time).
Work with the broader team to develop and deliver updated documentation and support knowledgebase for customers
Support and work with the customer service team to deliver customer service excellence.
Be a Nominet and solution subject matter expert within the Customer Success team to provide customers with the best experience.
Aware of customer-specific processes to be followed and SLAs to monitor and adhere to.
Assist with ad-hoc queries from customer and internal teams.
Work closely with the Nominet team to understand and drive solution improvements and stay abreast with planned changes to the solution.
Collaborate with UK-based colleagues (requires occasional after-hours meetings, flexibility in time-in-lieu provided where possible)
Assist Customer Success team in managing major and standard incidents that impact service and end customers.

About you and your experienceThe world of cyber security excites you and you’ll also have the following skills:

Good grasp of networking concepts, how DNS (Domain Name System) works, and general well-rounded competence in IT.
Experience of using ticketing systems
Good troubleshooting skills to work with customers to identify root cause or rule out probable causes.
Excellent communication skills and always willing to proactively reach out to customers via different channels.
Highly organised with a strong eye for detail.
Experience with Atlassian product, O365, Azure, Salesforce is preferred
Technical support/service desk experience is desired but not essential

Data protectionIf you choose to explore an opportunity, and subsequently share your CV or other personal details with Nominet, these details will be held by Nominet for 12 months in accordance with our Privacy Policy and used by our recruitment team and hiring managers in the process to contact you regarding this or other relevant opportunities at Nominet. If you would like Nominet to delete or update your details at any time, please follow the steps set out in the Privacy Policy describing your individual rights. If you have any questions about Nominet’s data protection practices, please email: dpo@nominet.ukEqual opportunitiesCybersecurity is a community effort. That’s why we’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone – unless they’re a cybercriminal, of course.We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we’d encourage you to join us whatever your background.We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality, or any other protected characteristic won’t affect your application.We want to give you every opportunity to show us your best self, so if there are any adjustments we could make to the recruitment and selection process to support you, please let us know.
Job Type: Full-time

Date: 09-Aug-2022 


Location:
 Brisbane, QLD, AU 


Department: Risk Advisory 


Description:
 Are you looking to leverage your Cyber experience on in one of the most diverse client markets? Read on! 

 What will your typical day look like? 
Based in Brisbane, we are looking for a Senior Manager to support and lead our Cyber Risk team. You will bring a strong balance of technical experience, communication and interpersonal skills, which will enable you to engage at all levels of an organisation around the cyber risk agenda. A wide range of security advisory services, such as cyber security strategy, threat and risk assessments, security design, testing and transformation. You will work within a diverse team who are passionate about helping organisations to assess, define and sustainably implement cyber security capability. 

 About the team 
Positioned first globally in Security Consulting Services for the 6th year in a row? Yep, that’s Deloitte. The cyberspace is constantly evolving and so are the threats that it brings. That is why our work is more meaningful (and exciting!) than ever. Always one-step ahead, we predict risks and safeguard our clients through end-to-end solutions. More importantly, we help clients unlock new opportunities through safer and more secure systems and policies. 

 Enough about us, let’s talk about you. 


You are someone with:


Proven experience in a cyber security or advisory role
Strong communication and problem-solving skills
Progress towards or completion of certifications is highly desirable e.g. CISSP, CISM, CCSP, CISA, OSCP, CEH, Security+
Experience in performing security threat and risk assessments and delivering projects relating to security strategy, governance, security architecture and capability improvement
Experience working with leading industry security frameworks – detailed knowledge of NIST, PSPF and ISM will be strongly regarded.
Technical experience in relation to cloud/ ERP/ Identity security, end point security, identity and access management or data protection will be strongly regarded
A strong desire to develop your leadership skills and impact, working across a range of digital and cyber transformation programs
You are a team player, collaborative and want to help your clients access the best of Deloitte by working closely with your peers in other capital cities and other countries were relevant
You want to play a client partnering role in the Brisbane cyber team and aspire to lead & build a cyber team around you as you progress your career towards becoming a Senior Manager.
 Why Deloitte? 
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

Take your career to the next level, by joining our passionate Security team and work on challenging projects that have immediate business impact.  Do you want to make a difference in the world? Join a company that can take you anywhere. With over 15,000 security specialists, Accenture Security is the only company in the world that has the global presence, commitment to innovation, unmatched industry know-how, and the business strategy acumen to tackle the world's most prevalent security challenges. Leveraging global resources and next-gen technologies, we create integrated, practical solutions that are tailored to each client's specific business goals and industry.  Accenture Security At Accenture Security we help clients address their industry-specific security vulnerabilities end-to-end, e.g. from mining raw minerals to autonomous electric vehicles, and everything in between. By exposing risks, you’ll not only counsel the C-suite on holistic solutions, you’ll fundamentally strengthen their business and truly transform how organisations work. You’ll deploy the most advanced, under-the-radar innovations. From collaborating with our global Cyber Labs to using advanced AI analytics, you’ll pioneer new frontline risk detection and defence strategies as part of the world’s #1 technology services company.

 Job Description As an Application Security Manager, you will be an emerging business leader, creating, nurturing and executing a shared vision of better security for our clients. You will help lead, manage and grow the team to perform application security services in close collaboration with our global and local teams and deliver high value cyber security capability for our clients.
 You will lead, assess, define, and supports the implementation of both traditional Application Security capabilities as well as modern DevSecOps solutions for Accenture or our clients. Engagements range from short term assessments to large-scale, enterprise transformations. Application Security solutions may involve program development, governance, enablement, cloud services, application containers, container orchestration services and serverless cloud functions. You will lead teams and provide consultative guidance to help clients implement Application Security capabilities that accelerate secure product development in both on-premise and cloud environments. You will also conduct Application Security assessments of client methodologies and architectures and define solutions that produce tailored solutions and operating models inclusive of target state people, processes, tools and technologies.

 Key Responsibilities: A professional at this position level within Accenture has the following responsibilities:

 Lead the ongoing development and innovation of the Application Security capability across Australia and New Zealand, growing a high-value, successful business. Develop and maintain an expert knowledge of the cyber threat landscape and how those threats could impact your clients.
 Develop and maintain a working knowledge of application security processes, patterns and trends; designing innovative security controls to help your clients manage their risk.
 Foster positive stakeholder relationships and work in collaboration with our global and local teams to understand a client’s challenges and help design and deliver innovative security solutions.
 Develop commercial proposals and statements of work to engage with your clients.
 Lead and coordinate the successful delivery of application security engagements for your clients.
 Leverage skills, experience and subject matter expertise to serve clients in a consultative role as well as in a technical capacity
 Lead pilots and proof-of-concept engagements to help clients create innovative security solutions through the use of new and emerging technologies
 Mentor, coach, supervise and develop team members
 Facilitate knowledge transfer and learning opportunities for team members to enhance their skills and experience
 Support efforts to identify, interview and hire talented professionals into the Secure Application Development domain


 Essential Qualifications

 3-5+ years of experience in leading teams and delivering projects
 Demonstrated interest in security, application development and cyber threats.
 Strong organisational, critical thinking and security analytical skills; ability to identify threats, security gaps in applications and provide recommendations and effective mitigation strategies
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to engage and maintain collaborative relationship with clients, executives, and team members effectively
 Be proactive in supporting team members and the greater security teams to navigate through challenges to issue resolution.




Beneficial Experience

 Have lead project delivery teams
 Experience designing, developing, deploying and securing web and cloud native applications
 Experience with Lean, Agile and/or DevOps methodologies
 Experience with DevOps CI/CD tools, capabilities and security integrations
 Experience with one or more Infrastructure as Code tools and technologies such as AWS CloudFormation Templates, Azure Resource Manager Templates, Google Cloud Deployment Manager Templates, OpenStack Heat, Terraform, Ansible, etc.
 Experience performing application security assessments that involve threat modeling, security testing, and vulnerability management and remediation
 Experience with public cloud platforms
 Cloud Certification (Practitioner, Security, Developer, Architect)
 Obtained relevant security industry certifications such as CTMP, CISSP, GCIA, CISA, CISM
 Familiar with security standards and frameworks such as ISO27000 Series, NIST CSF, and ASD ISM
 An active AGSVA clearance or willingness to obtain and retain an Australian Government security clearance
 Experience in incident response and analysis in a security operation centre environment
 Cyber threat intelligence experience

Currently, we're working with a variety of clients who are seeking out talented GRC consultants.If you're looking for your next challenge, we're keen to hear from you!
 Key Capabilities:

Sound knowledge of international standards for ICT Security Assessments
Experience with Security Frameworks inclusive of ISO27001, NIST, Essential 8, ISM, PSPF, DSPF
Ability to prepare information for high-risk profiles
Understanding and knowledge of the relevant legislature and security roadmaps
The ability to work with a diverse range of teams to identify and solve complex security issues to enable the protection of the wider security frameworks
AGSVA Security Clearance is highly desired.

About you:

CISSP, CCSP, CISM, CISA, CRISC or any other relevant qualification
Experience with Policy process and development
Strong resource management skills

A background in Cyber and Consulting

If you feel that you have the skillset which we are seeking, we would love to hear from you! Please apply online using the appropriate link. Alternatively, please contact Anuj Sabharwal via email at anuj.sabharwal@hudson.com for a confidential conversation.
 Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

Our Purpose
 


   We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a 
  
   culture of inclusion
   for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
 


   Job Title
 
 Senior Security Analyst - Adversary Emulation
  Who is Mastercard?
  Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
  Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.
  Overview
 

The Security Operations Defense and Automation (SODA) team is looking for a Senior Security Monitoring and Response Analyst to build out and drive maturity of our program and tools. The ideal candidate is passionate about securing Mastercard, highly motivated, intellectually curious, analytical, and possesses an entrepreneurial mindset. The role requires a blend of cybersecurity experience, communication skills, and leadership talents in order to protect Mastercard and provide support for Mastercard associates.

 Role
  In this position, you will:
 

Lead the design and implementation of the adversary emulation program and processes
Liase with other security teams in gathering cyber intelligence information regarding potential adversary groups
Identify testing methodologies that closely emulate the tactics, techniques, and procedures of cyber threat actors
Work closely with the Security Operations Center and other Mastercard teams to deploy alerts triggered by suspicious or malicious activity
Develop tracking metrics to provide a current view into Mastercard’s security risk level
Provide relevant technical details to peer teams to enhance adjacent programs such as red team, threat hunt, and security monitoring

 All About You
  Essential requirements of candidates:
 

Experience executing highly technical assessments, such as red teams, purple teams, penetration tests, etc
Proficient knowledge of Cobalt Strike or other C2 frameworks
Strong understanding of TCP/IP, Mitre ATT&CK, Kill Chain, Vulnerability Management and Networking principles
Experience with scripted/command languages such as PowerShell, python, ruby, bash, etc
Experience with Windows, Unix Based Operating Systems, and Cloud Security fundementals
Strong problem-solving skills to effectively research investigate and offer solutions to issues that are more complex and difficult in nature
Ability to work effectively in ambiguous and/or high-pressure situations
Be skilled at explaining technical problems succinctly and clearly
Be a strong, confident, and exacting writer and speaker, able to communicate your vision and roadmap effectively to a wide variety of stakeholders

 NOTE: Candidates go through a thorough screening and interview process. There is no need to include all preferred skills in the job description.
 

   COVID-19 Considerations
 

   In many locations, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in our NYC offices, as required by law, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 will be permitted inside Mastercard offices unless a reasonable accommodation has been approved in advance.
 


   Corporate Security Responsibility
   All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
 

 Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
 Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
 Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
 Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

The role of Senior Application Security Engineer is responsible for embedding security into how we work while allowing teams to maintain their autonomy and flexibility.
 About us!
 Sportsbet's purpose is to bring excitement to life for its customers and we do this by over-delivering on excitement through serious fun, disrupting the status quo and living our values. We’re a flexible, progressive, open-minded, and inclusive employer with over 7,000 cool, clever and curious people around the world. As part of the Flutter Group, we’re a global player, but in Melbourne, Sydney and Darwin we’re tight knit, with 1,000 of us bringing excitement to life every day.
 Our commitment to responsible gambling is genuine and demonstrated through the wide range of responsible gambling initiatives and tools
 The Sportsbet Cybersecurity team is a diverse group of experienced professionals who enjoy the challenge and complexity involved in fast-growing digital organisation. They are passionate about protecting our customer data, take pride in their work, but know how to have fun while doing it. We’re looking for an individual to join the team and contribute in their own style, bringing their unique experiences and skills.


 About the role
 The key focus of the Senior Application Security Engineer role will be to embed security into how we work while allowing teams to maintain their autonomy and flexibility. This role will focus on applications security, and will lead the implementation of pragmatic, sensible security solutions and processes. The Product Security Engineer will partner with, and support, our development teams in a shared security responsibility model to ensure our applications are secure by default.
 Based in Melbourne, we offer flexible, hybrid and part time working options and would be open to discussing what flexibility means to you.
 Key responsibilities include:

Build systems and workflows to drive manual and automated security decision making within the Sportsbet’s software development life cycle.
Deliver outcomes that demonstrably improve our security posture and reduce our risk.
Partner with our internal product/engineering teams and security testing providers, to further embed application security and continuously improve maturity through all stages of development and delivery.
Work on embedding security best practices such as least privilege, isolation, monitoring, authentication and authorization across Sportsbet’s application development ecosystem.
Create proof of concepts, where applicable, to enable one click reproduction of issues, mitigations or demonstration of security control effectiveness.



 About You
 We’re looking for someone with deep interest in software security and who is well versed with current trends that plague software security and have opinions on how to address these issues.

2-3 years of software development/programming experience with at least one high level language (Python, Golang, Typescript, etc) followed by 3+ years within appsec focused roles.
Comfortable interacting with source code repository related features like Github Actions.
General understanding of how cloud hosted applications and services work.
Ability to: 
   


Work with Agile/DevOps based release cycles
Review source code to assess security implications and requirements
Quickly learn about what you need, dig in and make sense of a problem that is poorly defined or outside of your expertise.
Understand that like everything else, security work must be prioritised and have the acumen to know when to compromise and when to hold your ground.

Familiarity with common security flaws, security controls and libraries.
Ability to review code to discover and suggest mitigations for SQLi, XSS, SSRF, authentication, authorization, and other web based and mobile security vulnerabilities.
Knowledge of common authentication technologies including OAuth, SAML, etc.
Experience with common application security tools.




The Perks
 We work hard and play hard, so along with a very competitive salary and generous performance-based bonus, we will also provide you with:

25 days annual leave (a whole extra week of holidays!)
Tailored career development programs, as well as a commitment to developing Thought Leader and Specialist Talent programs
Genuine flexible working and remote working policy with an $850 work from home office allowance
Discounted gym memberships, free breakfast and loads of event and conference tickets and many more
Access to Headspace App and an employee assist program
Best in class Parental Leave program with six months paid leave for Primary Carers and Circle In membership

We’re a flexible, progressive, open-minded, and inclusive employer who welcomes you for who you are, as you are- that’s why we assess behaviours, learning agility and expertise to ensure all types of experiences are considered for our roles. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we review candidates with 2-3 weeks of advertising.
 Ready to bring excitement to life? Apply now

Role: Security Architect Location: Sydney + Hybrid Division: Advisory

Recommend solutions and oversee their implementation
Scope to build out your niche
Have your ideas heard and acted on
Part of a boutique firm, nimble enough to move with the times
Long-term clients to see your impact over time

About The Role
 Security Centric are looking to recruit a talented individual to act as the primary guiding interface between clients and the delivery team. You will identify and direct how client cyber security challenges/objectives can be resolved/achieved by the Security Centric delivery team.
 The candidate will work with the security engineering and delivery team, reporting to the practice Principal. The team is comprised of highly skilled and motivated security professionals, that are focused on helping organisations achieve their strategic information security objectives through hands-on engineering and related activities.
 Experience in a similar consultancy role is desirable although not a requirement, however given this is a client facing role excellent communications skills are essential. Ideally, the candidate would have a strong technical background coupled with cyber security strategy exposure to assist clients in achieving organisational objectives.
 Candidates should possess the following experience or knowledge:



10+ years experience in IT
5+ years experience in cyber security
Experience and competence in common enterprise technologies such as on-premise infrastructure, public and private cloud solutions including Azure and AWS.
Experience in a professional services or consultancy capacity.
Familiar with cyber security risk mitigation techniques such as hardening, defence in depth.
Familiar with enterprise information security operations.
Familiar with information security frameworks such as ISO 27001, NIST CSF, NIST 800-53, PCI DSS, ISM, APRA CPS 234, SOC2.
Desire to join a small team and grow it.
Desire to make a step up to more responsibility in a senior position but get hands-on if required.



About You
 The ideal candidate would have obtained a bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, information technology or similar after leaving high school. You would have gained experience in various IT roles, moving to engineering/professional services and have performed ICT system/solution design. You are likely to have supported sales in a presales engineering capacity, working for an IT service provider or systems integrator, before either specialising in security within a large firm, or moving to a cyber security specialist. 
You are capable of much more than your current responsibilities permit due to the organisational structure, feeling like a small fish in a large pond. You emotional intelligence, broad technical experience, work ethic and entrepreneurial nature makes the move to a boutique up-and-comer a logical next step in your career, where they can make their mark, have your voice and ideas heard and play an instrumental part in a future success story.
 Ideal Characteristics


Industry qualifications such as CISSP, CISM, GIAC, PCI QSA, IRAP, SABSA.

Technical competence in multiple enterprise ICT areas such as Windows Domains, networking, Microsoft 365 security capabilities, SIEM/SOC/threat detection, forensics, penetration testing, identify and access control, DevOps, vulnerability management or modern architectures such as containers and serverless computing.
Experience in a managed security services provider.
Some experience on the client side of working with outsourced cyber security providers.



What We Offer
 This role offers a highly competitive salary, ongoing learning and development plan for certifications and flexible working arrangements. The diversity of our customer base exposes you to varied and interesting industries including both government agencies and private sector organisations and facilitates the opportunity to learn new skills ultimately growing your skill set and enriching your career.
 This role will be based in Sydney and will have a mixture of office working, home working and some travel to client sites

Date: 22-Aug-2022 


Location:
 Sydney, NSW, AU 


Department: Enabling Areas 


Description:

Job Requisition ID: 30091 



Work in a highly innovative and transformative business
Work/life balance with access to flexible work arrangements
Salary packaging – to suit your personal and financial circumstances
 What will your typical day look like? 

 Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next[1]generation, cutting-edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with other experts in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture? 

 Role Responsibilities 

 As a Cyber Security Analyst, you will be part of the Deloitte Cyber Threat Intelligence team within Deloitte Technology. Your primary responsibility will be to review internal network activity to find indicators of adversaries seeking access to our systems and to also extract key artifacts can be used to cluster activity. You will help collect, process, and review raw data to identify anomalous activity and map your findings based on accepted industry frameworks. You will then write tactical reports highlighting unique insights and observations regarding our threat landscape. You will assist the team with answering requests for analysis and information from stakeholders on an ad-hoc basis. You will also assist in delivering verbal briefings to Deloitte stakeholders ranging from CISOs to network defenders. You will conduct open-source research, to include on the deep and dark Web, to support our intrusion analysis. You will assist the team with creating scripts to automate the collection, processing, and regular daily tasks as needed. You will also support our team’s information-sharing with other organizations and associations. Finally, you will help keep our Threat Intelligence Platform updated with the latest information about our threat landscape. Australian citizenship is required for this position 

 About the team 

 Deloitte Global inspires leaders at every level. We believe in investing in you, helping you embrace leadership opportunities at every step of your career, and helping you identify and hone your unique strengths. We encourage you to grow by providing formal and informal development programs, coaching and mentoring, and on-the-job challenges. We want you to ask questions, take chances, and explore the possible. 

 Enough about us, let’s talk about you. 


You are someone with:
 Minimum of three years related to cyber security operations, including work in threat intelligence 
Proven track record in a highly complex and global organization Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills 
Experience exercising mature judgement, and demonstrate capability of doing independent work Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills 
Experience and/or ability to code in Python and/or PowerShell 
Fluency in English, to include being able to write reports and give briefings 

 Preferred 

 Minimum of two years of cyber threat intelligence experience 
Minimum of one year experience with malware analysis 
Experience in open-source research 
Understand and evaluate the cyber threat landscape, and assess what threats are most relevant to Deloitte and the Deloitte executive audience 
Conduct insightful research on observed and noteworthy threats, as discovered using open and proprietary sources Supply actionable recommendations to other teams within the Fusion Center to bolster cyber security efforts 
Experience working in geographically separated teams Experience writing Snort and Yara signatures Experience with Threat Intelligence Platforms Understanding of written Mandarin Chinese, Russian, or Persian 
GIAC Certified Cyber Threat Intelligence (GCTI) GIAC Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA) GIAC Network Forensic Analyst (GNFA) Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Similar professional security certifications 

 Why Deloitte? 
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. 

 We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive. 

 We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Job Summary: 
 
 Amentum is seeking an
   Info System Security Officer to join our team at the Joint Defense Facility Pine Gap (JDFPG) located in 
  Alice Springs, Australia.
 
 The Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) reports directly to the Information Systems security Manager and provides support to the ISSM in the development and management of operational information systems security implementation policy, procedures, and guidelines.
 The ISSO is responsible for the preparation, review, and update of authorisation packages. The ISSO ensures approved procedures are in place for clearing, sanitizing, and destroying various types of hardware and media.

   Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
 

 Conduct periodic reviews of information systems to ensure compliance with the security authorization package, notify ISSM when changes occur that might affect the authorization determination of the information system(s)
 Coordinate any changes or modifications to hardware, software, or firmware of a system with the ISSM and AO/DAO prior to the change
 Monitor system recovery processes to ensure security features and procedures are properly restored and functioning correctly
 Ensure all IS security-related documentation is current and accessible to properly authorized individuals, ensure audit records are collected, reviewed, and documented (to include any anomalies)
 Attend required technical and security training (e.g., operating system, networking, security management) relative to assigned duties
 Execute the cyber security portion of the self-inspection, to include provide security coordination and review of all system assessment plans
 Identify cyber security vulnerabilities and assist with the implementation of the countermeasures for them
 Prepare reports on the status of security safeguards applied to computer systems
 Ensure compliance with all site’s environmental health and safety requirements
 Any other reasonable duties as requested
 Minimum Requirements: 
 
Undergraduate Degree in Information Technology, cybersecurity, information systems management, or other relevant discipline or applicable technical licensure
 10+ years of experience in Information Technology
 Working knowledge of IT business systems and integrated software applications
 Experience managing IT projects, technology refreshes, and small teams
 Familiarity with RMF and I.T. security regulations
 Driver’s License
 Security +
 Related advanced IT certification
 Must be a US citizen and possess or be able to obtain a TS SCI with poly or an Australian citizen and possess or be able to obtain a TSPV


 Preferred Qualifications: 
 
Master’s degree in Information Technology, cybersecurity, information systems management, or other relevant discipline
 Microsoft Certification
 Linux Certification

What you'll be doingThis is a key role in the Product and Technology group at Catch providing Cyber security risk and governance expertise to the technology group that supports the whole Catch business.This role will drive the identification, assessment and tracking of all technology risks across the company. You will assess security controls and play a key role in the uplift and enhancement of Information Security capabilities across Catch.The time is now to be part of the Catch team. No two days are alike, and we are embarking on remarkable growth.
You Could Expect Your Typical Day To Include Some Of The Following Things:

Drive the identification, assessment, tracking and reporting of IT risks across the company.
Help embed a risk culture across Catch.
Support the Security Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) Manager to uplift key functions necessary for the effective management of security and technology including compliance, policy, third party risk, reporting and controls uplift.
Review and enhance the information security policy and standards.
Collaborate with peers in other Wesfarmers divisions to uplift and improve Catch security governance and risk practices.
Support other related functions as required including the Payment Fraud/Cyber Security awareness team.
Manage expectations of a range of stakeholders with the Information Security team and broader Product & Technology group.
Assist and co-ordinate various audit activities that are required by the business and track treatment of audit and compliance items.
Develop summaries, dashboards, reports and key metric profiles to identify gaps and trends for IT management.
Manage and conduct third party security risk assessments.
Assess key controls protecting Catch data and identify additional controls to minimise risk of a data breach.

The skills you’ll have

Relevant qualifications in IT risk, cybersecurity (i.e. CISSP, CRISC, etc.), or related fields.
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in IT risk or cybersecurity. Experience in Digital, Retail or Distribution businesses will be valued, although not necessary.
A good understanding of IT Risk Management, Audit and Cybersecurity principles frameworks and technologies (i.e. NIST – CSF, ISO27000) is necessary to succeed in this role.
Technical knowledge of the following areas would be advantageous:

o Familiarity with securing cloud services (AWS/Azure) · DevSecOps security best practice.o Understanding of various security technologies (i.e. vulnerability management, SIEM, email filtering tools, endpoint protection, M365 etc.)

Excellent influencing skills, process oriented with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to transition quickly from detailed analytical work to work requiring conceptual and abstract thinking

Join our team of CatchiesThere has never been a more exciting time to join the Catch Team!!Our people are at the heart of everything we do and will go above and beyond for our customers “To be the trusted place where Australians start their shopping journey”.Working at Catch, you’ll experience: 

Flexibility comes in all shapes and sizes at Catch, and as part of our commitment to flexibility, we offer all team members the opportunity to take control over when, where and how work is accomplished depending on your role.
To help our team members juggle the demands of work and life, our health and wellbeing program aims to encourage positive morale and help employees reduce stress through the promotion of work/ life balance.
To enable our team members to give back to our communities, we offer a day’s paid volunteer leave
My Catch Perks - up to 5% discount off selected retailers including Kmart, Target, Bunnings and Officeworks
An organisation that is experiencing incredible growth
Support and collaboration, not just with their immediate team, but with the broader organisation as well!
Other unbelievable benefits and perks like free Club Catch membership, study support, in house learning and development, parental leave programs, plus loads more...

*Who are Catch?*Back in 2006, Catch set out to shake up Australia’s online retail landscape. We’ve come a long way since!We’re not just one of the country’s top eCommerce players, with a proven track record of growth, an award-winning digital platform and second to none customer experience offering. Behind the scenes, we’re a world-class team of creatives, strategists, developers and innovators, and we’re on the hunt for like-minded people to jump on board.We make the rules. We push boundaries. We think big. We stay curious and driven. Together, we embrace challenges and learn new things. All this, for one purpose: to provide our customers with an amazing online shopping experience, every day.And we’re just getting started…At Catch, we welcome all applications and screen them without attention to race, age, beliefs, sex, orientation, gender identity and disability.

job_title: Cyber Security Risk and Compliance Manager
job_summary:
The Security Manager is responsible for the definition, implementation, operation and governance of the organisation's security, risk, and compliance capabilities across IT. The Security Manager will lead the establishment of the appropriate security controls, standards, security architecture and risk processes and provide leadership for Cyber Security, Risk and compliance whilst working collaboratively with business and IT stakeholders.
 About You
 The Security Manager is responsible for the definition, implementation, operation and governance of the organisation's security, risk and compliance capabilities across IT. The Security Manager will lead the establishment of the appropriate security controls, standards, security architecture and risk processes and provide leadership for Cyber Security, Risk and compliance whilst working collaboratively with business and IT stakeholders. The Security manager will:
 Ensure a strategic and integrated approach to cyber security, policies and processes with a focus on information management and effective risk-based decision making across the organisation

Manage the IT security controls, standards and processes including 
   
Oversee security architecture covering identity and access management
Interrogate the effectiveness of the implementation of security controls in support of compliance, information and risk management
Determine security requirements by evaluating business strategies, IT investments and project requirements and define security requirements to protect assets and service levels
Conducts system security and vulnerability analyses and risk assessments

Set, manage and maintain the IT security policies and strategies by; 
   
Developing and maintaining the information Security Policy and supporting processes
Defining and ensuring adherence to security policies and standards and ensure that confidentiality, integrity and availability of the services are maintained
Constantly update the security strategy and policies to leverage new technology and threat information or compliance changes

Responsible for the day-to-day management of risk and compliance in the delivery of IT services 
   
Owns and manages the IT risk management framework and works with key business and IT stakeholders to communicate and manage IT risks.
Identify and tackle compliance requirements and build awareness of compliance requirements within the organisation.

Serve as the process owner of all assurance activities related to the availability, integrity and confidentiality of employee and business information in compliance with the Victorian Protective Data Security Framework (VPDSF)
Lead the relationships with internal and external auditors and oversee proactive management and closure of audit and regulator findings
Contribute to operational and strategic governance forums providing thought leadership for the respective security, risk and compliance domains.
Conduct investigations after breaches or incidents, including impact analysis and recommendations for avoiding similar vulnerabilities. Lead the incident response for cyber related breaches leveraging partnerships with other government agencies.

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

5+ years' experience within IT and Security with a minimum of two years in an IT security management role.
Exposure to a broad range of IT functions and disciplines, with a strong working knowledge of IT governance and/or information governance
Knowledge of common information security management frameworks, such as ISO/IEC 27001, ASD, COBIT and NIST.
Knowledge of enterprise information and cyber security processes, concepts, and best practices, with an exposure to public cloud models is desirable.
Demonstrated capability in effective reporting to executive management and/or Board.
Regulatory compliance knowledge including PCI, VPDSF as well as knowledge and experience of network and infrastructure security and vulnerabilities.
Demonstrated technical expertise in ICT security and the application of ICT security measures.
Experience across other security areas including penetration testing, security architecture or design and security governance including hands-on experience implementing security solutions
Working knowledge of The Victorian Protective Data Security Framework (VPDSF) and the Information Management Framework for the Victorian Public Sector and the Public Records Office Victoria Specifications and Standards is highly desirable.
IT Risk and/or compliance management experience is preferred
CISSP/CISM or equivalent certifications preferred

HOW TO APPLY:
 Please submit your resume (in MS Word Format) for consideration via the link below. A cover letter demonstrating your relevant experience may also be reviewed.
 Should you wish to discuss, please contact Neha Agrawal at neha.agrawal@hudson.com , quoting reference number 216104.
 Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

job_title: Senior Cyber Security Analyst - Risk & Controls
job_summary:
What makes us, us


Established in 1840, we’re Australia’s first member-owned wellbeing company, delivering health, wealth and care services to more than 700,000 Australians. Today, while we’ve grown to a company of more than 7000 employees, our focus remains the same as it was 180 years ago — to deliver Real Wellbeing for our customers, members and the community.


We support your Real Wellbeing so you can better support our members’ and customers’ wellbeing journey


There are four key attributes that set us apart:



Good people: We strive to set ourselves apart through the capability, warmth and expertise of our people.
Wellbeing experts: Our breadth of capability enables us to provide smart solutions and services across all domains of wellbeing.
Long-term commitment: As a member-owned company, we’ve been focusing on long-term outcomes and single-minded dedication to our members and customers since 1840.
Driving positive impact: Everything we do is focused on making a positive difference at a personal, community and societal level.


 
These pillars are infused with our values of bold, warm and honest


Our Opportunity


Reporting to the Head of Cyber Security - Technology Risks and Controls, in this role you will assist with the implementation and operation of the cyber security practices to ensure reliability, resilience and compliance of Australian Unity technology systems against external and internal threats. These threats may impact information confidentiality, integrity and service availability, in turn you will ensure protection of mission critical systems and information assets, management of technology risks, thereby enhancing operational resilience.


Key to this role will be your collaboration with internal stakeholders to translate risk appetite, risk metrics and mitigation controls into business discussions, reporting KRIs, risk appetite metrics and business decisions. You will act as a subject matter expert to define, implement, maintain and ensure consistency of end to end information security controls and solutions. Act as audit liaison, oversee information security arrangements in third party arrangements, lead control testing.


What we are looking for



Demonstrated information security control and program framework experience including risk management, security controls design and implementation.
Thorough understanding of cyber security analysis and delivery in addition to knowledge of IT security best practice and solutions.
Knowledge of PCI DSS, ISO27001, APRA CPS 234, NIST Standards (800-53, CSF), OWASP Top 10, CWE/SANS Top 25 and WASC.
Experience in the selection and systematic application of appropriate indicators/metrics to evaluate and measure information security management program effectiveness.
GWAPT, CEH, OSCP, CISSP certifications or equivalent.
Good understanding of IT infrastructure.
The ability to work independently and prioritise work to manage conflicting deadlines.
Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management capability.


 
Our Benefits  You will enjoy a range of great employee benefits and rewards including:

Competitive Remuneration and variable bonus
A range of attractive product and service discounts from Australian Unity’s Retail and Wealth Management portfolio – including health insurance and banking products
Flexible Working Arrangements including Work-From-Home days with a real work-life balance
Available access to LinkedIn Learning courses through our great Learning platform
Additional paid Wellbeing and Volunteer leave days yearly


 
Where to from here?


Please contact Richard Maher, Talent Acquisition Practise Lead, for a confidential discussion or more details – rimaher@australianunity.com.au. 
Please note that all Australian Unity employees must be fully vaccinated for COVID 19. Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people.

job_title: Technical Trainer – Cyber Security – Australia or Singapore
job_summary:
Job Title:
 Technical Trainer – Cyber Security – Australia or Singapore
 Role Overview:
 Trellix: Living security that makes organizations more resilient through the interconnection of a wide variety of threat sensors and capabilities.
 Trellix combines the best of two predecessors. We offer a fresh approach to ensure all organizations have security built into their DNA, with advanced detection, response, and remediation. This transformation embraces the incredible portfolio and talent of McAfee Enterprise and FireEye and sets us on the path to re-define the future of cybersecurity.
 Working within our APAC Education Services team as a Technical Trainer with learn the capability to deliver customer training in at least 4 x Trellix solutions. You will be working across the APAC region to deliver training to our customers and partners with a primary focus on Asia wide deliveries – virtual and in classroom. You will be expected to be involved in New Training opportunities, scoping calls and also training delivery planning calls in partnership with the Education Services Head and the Sales Manager whenever required based on your availability.

Specific Responsibilities/Functions

Representing the Trellix Education Services team through unquestionable integrity and a mastery of your field(s) of expertise
Staying abreast of new Trellix technologies and associated training.
Deliver a wide variety of post-sales technical solution training activities including public and private classroom instruction, virtual classroom training using video conference based tools, one to one and small group coaching.
Engage and deliver using the Trellix Education Services Methodology, including defining, deploying and analysing assessments.
Contribute to, review and beta-teach new classes; working in partnership with the development team
Build working relationships with Sales and Customer Success colleagues to position the best education opportunities with customers and prospects
Being an advocate for cybersecurity education externally to Trellix. E.g. talking at conferences, engaging with Schools and Universities, social media presence.
Building effective working relationships with Trellix specialists (e.g. engineering, support, professional services) to deepen your technical reach into the technologies and be able to connect students with the answer to any question they may present
Work collaboratively with the Education Services team, proactively engage on the operational side of the business and maintain data in the Learning Management System where required.
You will be expected to be delivering training during 70% of your time each quarter following an intensive ramp up period.
Manage all the training related logistics pertaining to the trainings that you deliver such as attendee invites, joining details, communications plus post training internal document sharing.
Modify or create training content on an adhoc basis if required.

Experience, Knowledge and Skills

Have an ongoing broad understanding of the cybersecurity landscape in the APAC region and impacts this may have on individuals and organisations in terms of education
Experience in delivering formal hands on technical product training to a broad customer and/or partner student base – Classroom and Virtual Instructor led
More than 5 years experience working in technical capacity in the IT industry, ideally in cybersecurity and/or cloud.
Strong public presentation and communication skills and a high standard of documentation.
Understanding of enterprise security strategy and where it fits within an organization to meet the client business goals and requirements
Previous professional services/consulting experience desirable.
Previous experience in managing/working with Security solutions offered under the McAfee Enterprise banner is highly desirable.
Fluent in English. Ability to deliver in other languages will be desirable.
Can do/will do attitude.


Company Benefits and Perks:

We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.

Pension and Retirement Plans
Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
Paid Time Off
Paid Parental Leave
Support for Community Involvement

We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why we prohibit discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

Who Are we?
 


   As a world-leading provider of workplace technology, Ricoh is all about improving work life by providing better user experiences, optimised workflows, anytime anywhere collaboration, and digital infrastructure solutions.
 


   At Ricoh, we harness the infinite potential of the collective imagination as our daily pursuit. Embracing a culture of openness, we welcome all ideas. Our purpose is to shape the future of work and the sustainability of our world and use its infinite potential to truly imagine change.
 


   Is this the role for you?
 

   Ricoh Australia is aiming to provide an opportunity for a recent Cyber Security Graduate to join our team to focus on strengthening our Cyber Security posture.
 


   As the Information Security Analyst, you will be responsible for contributing to and improving the Information Security program in Ricoh Australia, with the primary goal of ensuring that appropriate security controls are in place and effective.
 

   You will become the subject matter expert on the security posture, controls, compliance, and initiatives across Ricoh Australia.
 


   As a ISO27001 accredited company, you will be key in strengthening and expanding our capabilities. You will have the technical understanding to be self-sufficient in managing day to day Information and Cyber Security related operations and assist in audit activities.
 


   Key Responsibilities include:
 

 Delivery of locally and globally driven Information Security roadmap initiatives
 Security threat and incident response
 System Patching and vulnerability assessment
 Technical assistance and ownership of security focused day to day activities
 Assistance in system hardening and secure technical design
 ISMS and ISO 27001 program delivery
 Audit program participation
 Security policy and process contribution
 Contribution and engagement across key governance frameworks including but not limited to risk management, asset management and change management
 Contribution to and maintenance of Security Operations Body of Knowledge
 Tender response and partner program requirements analysis
 Technology project governance and due diligence relative to Information Security



   To be successful in this role:
 


   To be successful in this role you will ideally demonstrate:
 

 Bachelor degree (or equivalent) in Cyber Security; or Information Technology with a demonstrable Cyber Security focus
 Some work experience would be an advantage
 Knowledge of ISO 27001 or similar certification standards
 Relevant IT certifications (CISSP, MCP, CCNA, Security +, etc.)
 Strong written language and presentation skills
 Governance framework exposure (ITIL / Prince2 / COBIT)



   What we give back to you?
 


   At Ricoh, we take pride in giving back for your contribution to our success. We offer a range of benefits including:
 

 Paid Parental Leave
 Purchased Leave Scheme
 Unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning
 Participation in our RedE recognition program
 Free income protection cover
 Wellness program
 Novated leasing

About Us:
 FinXL IT Professional Services is an established innovative Australian company providing technology enabled business solutions and consulting services across a number of industries including Government, Telecommunications, Commercial and Finance. We currently have more than 850 consultants assisting our clients across Australia and are continuing to grow at a rapid pace. Through the delivery of services and implementation of new systems, processes and technology, we assist our clients to gain competitive advantage and reach new heights.
 
The role:
 The Cyber Security Engineer will be responsible for contributing to the operations of the Infrastructure Support team, including; maintenance and support of existing infrastructure, delivery of technical projects and improvements to departmental ICT systems.
 
The requirements:

 Undertake reporting, investigations, assessment and remediation of security threats for the IT Security Advisor.
 Contribute to solution design, in conjunction with Information Services Branch Architects and the CTO.
 Producing and reviewing project/services delivery documentation including Architecture, Designs, 'As built documentation' and Operating Procedures.
 Building and Maintaining Stakeholder relationships (Including Executives, Business Representatives, project Managers and staff across government).

 The skills: 

A strong working knowledge of the Information Security Manual (ISM), the Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF), and other International Standards (ISO's).
 Experience working as a security engineer for medium/large enterprise or federal government
 Understanding of system hardening solutions and configurations required to protect sensitive information
